Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ESQ_14920
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located right by a u-ban station. The hotel staff was friendly and our room was just what you expect from Marriott. We had a lovely suite. The living area was a separate room, a true suit, not just a half wall. Both the bedroom and living area were large.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: This is one the better Marriotts I have stayed at. Their concierge lounge is one of the best in terms of service, offerings and available hours. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a nice Gym, and pool in the hotel. As an elite member, you get free internet and free access to the concierge lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: maggie b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and in an awesome location. It was very close to all the main attractions, an easy train and bus ride to Tegel, great shopping, and the rooms were very nice. Berlin is such a neat place to visit. We will return back to this hotel. If you stay here, make sure you eat at VaPianos-2 minute walk from the hotel. We ate there 3 nights in a row-VERY good. The only down fall to this hotel is the expensive wifi. We had coffee at Starbucks next door everyday and used the free wifi there.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Keisi S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were doing an 18 day whirlwind trip in Europe going to see London, Paris, Berlin, and Rome. This was the best hotel we stayed at! The price was a little bit more but it's a Marriott so you know what standard of service to expect. The man at the front desk was very welcoming and friendly when we checked in even though it was after midnight. The concierge spoke excellent English and helped us find a place to buy our underground passes. The location was great within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate and next to Potsdamer Platz, even though the Ritz Carlton was having a high profile political meeting during our stay, it was relatively easy to get to the hotel even with the 40 policemen surrounding the square. The temperature and cleanliness were perfect, and the staff respected our 'do not disturb' sign even though they wanted to service our room. (I prefer not to have staff come into a room while I'm staying there, just for security). The restaurant in the hotel was the BEST MEAL in Europe that we had (and not the most expensive). We got room service the morning of check out and it was on time and the food was great. They also have an amazing sauna, work out room and pool that's quiet. In any other city in Europe this hotel and their restaurant would have been twice as expensive. This is the second time i've stayed here and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great lounge, awesome restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SwissPapa
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend with my wife in Berlin last December and chose this property for its location and the reviews I read. I must say I was not disappointed. This hotel really is worth every penny. The room was beautiful, the staff very helpful, and the location right by the Potsdamer Platz ideal to get around the city. Best feature: the Marriott member lounge at the top floor. What a great place to retreat after touring the city all day and enjoy some snacks and a drink or two while taking in the fabulous view across the roofs of Berlin. I also liked the daily afternoon snack surprises that were hand-delivered to the room - a wonderful and unexpected treat. To round up our trip, we chose to have dinner at the in-house Midtown Grill. This restaurant can compete with any American steakhouse. It truly was a wonderful experience: fabulous food and great service & atmosphere. Try the liver Berliner Art and enjoy the unique way it's presented. A suprising 'dessert treat on the house' (marshmellows w/sticks to be grilled over a small tabletop open firepit) was the perfect ending to a perfect dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Brewsta
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid for 3 nights at the Marriott near Potsdamer Platz. It has a great central location, a 10 minute walk from the Brandenberg Gate and plenty of transportation links at the S-Bahn and U-Bahn station nearby. On check in, I was asked if I wanted breakfast, I said no. I was asked if I wanted Wi-Fi Internet for 20 euros extra per day. I said no. I was asked if I would like to upgrade to a better room on a higher floor with a view with Wi-Fi included for 20 extra euros. I said yes. The room was nice and the bed was supercomfortable. Great pillows and lots of them. After about 24 hours, the Wi-Fi stopped working. Very frustrating when you need to do emails and don't want to start paying data roaming charges on your iPhone. I called the front desk and was referred to the service provider, iBahn. After 15 minutes on the phone with them, I was told it should be fixed in a few hours. When we returned later that evening, it still did not work. I was told by iBahn they were escalating the case and a technician would be on site to fix it. The next morning it still didn't work. I registered a complaint with the front desk and was told it would be addressed at check out. When we checked out on Sunday, I again mentioned my frustration with the Wi-Fi. The woman at the desk told me she was aware of my unhappiness. She then ran my credit card and charged me 60 euros for the room upgrade (that was supposed to include Wi-Fi). I said :Wait a minute, I paid for a service you promised me and you didn't provide it. I don't think I should pay for it." She said, "You had an upgraded room. If you were unhappy, you could have moved back to a lesser room. Wasn't that offered to you when you complained?" No, it wasn't offered. Then she said, "I can give you back 10 euros per day. Do you want that?" I thought it was a strange question. Who doesn't want 30 euros, especially after going through so much frustration, not to mention the unsympathetic treatment at checkout? That's how it ended. We left rather surprised at the level of customer service for a hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: dayfornight99
Reviews.Content: I could find no fault with this hotel except for one: 20 euro per day to use the internet. In a time when places from Starbucks to McDonald's offer free internet service, I will no longer give a 5 star review to any hotel that price gouges on internet usage. With this, "At your service" is missing one key component. It is an absolutely lovely hotel, you will enjoy your stay if you have cell service in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, many amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Uh60josh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Best breakfast I've ever gotten at a hotel. Gym is state of the art and includes a pool and two different temperature saunas. Has its own bar with the most extensive whiskey and scotch menu ever. They have "the John Walker" that goes for €370 a glass. Right down the street from the Brandenburg Gate and the Tier Garden. Berlin is a city with a lot of sadness. It made me feel much better returning to such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emandernie
Reviews.Content: The staff here are super efficient and very friendly. Room size was great, larger than most European city hotels. We had lounge access and their evening meal (not snack) was extremely well done. Sleep quality was unsurpassed. Well done to the staff overall

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and relaxing in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times now but not for a couple of years; going back with a friend it was still just as welcoming and impressive walking in to the lobby as ever. Friendly, polite, English speaking staff checked us in without any fuss, giving us a room on a high floor as requested. The superior room on the 8th floor was stunning - two walls of floor to ceiling windows with great views of the Fernseeturm and Potsdamer Platz. Complimentary bottled water and wifi (once confirmed the price tags didn't apply!) were a great bonus. The huge walk in shower was spectacular and the complimentary toiletries were especially useful having traveled with just hand luggage. Breakfast at the weekends is until 3pm and even later in the day still fresh and tasty. Got caught out on the Monday morning, thinking it was served til 11 but actually 10.30 so was a bit rushed but still good. Lobby bar is nice although not somewhere you'd spend that long as more business lounge like; shame they closed their old bar as that did some delicious cocktails and was one of the reasons I'd chosen to go back and take my friend. Still a good selection however. Swimming pool, sauna and gym added that nice luxury relaxation to the trip; somewhere nice to go and unwind in after walking around the city, for which this hotel is conveniently located. Being a Marriott it's in the upper price bracket but value for money is excellent, the staff, rooms and facilities are definitely worth every penny. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Busines Hotel in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: Plahottie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business travel and had a chance to enjoy some of what Berlin has to offer. It was a short walk from Unter den Linden, which made it great for a walk to visit some local museums. I got lucky and walked right into the Berlin Guggenheim as well on a free day. This hotel is close to a Starbucks (everywhere now in Berlin) and a Vapiano (which I did go to), but is a short cab ride away from many great spots.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: FRAN510
Reviews.Content: My family and i were very impressed with this hotel. A waiter spoke spanish and was very friendly, the rooms very nice decorated. We recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the second best location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: voronUk
Reviews.Content: That depends on your tastes, of course. Personally I don't see how you could top the Hotel Adlon down at the Brandenburger Tor, but this isn't drastically further away and imho vies only with the Hilton in the serene Gendarmenmarkt for second place. So, location. In a tiny square behind the Ritz-Carlton, just off Potsdamer Platz. Easily accessible to taxis; €20 from Tegel, €17 to Tegel thanks to lighter traffic. That'll change from early June when the new airport opens, of course. Turn left out of the front door and you're literally a minute or so from Potsdamer Platz with its U and S-Bahn stations, shopping and cinemas. Turn right out of the front door and the trees ahead of you are the edge of Tiergarten, Berlin's huge public park. Turn right at the Tiergarten, follow the edge of it round a few hundred metres and ahead of you are the memorial to Europe's murdered Jews, the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag and the start of Unter den Linden. Tiergarten itself is a very nice place to start your morning with a jog, bike ride or just a gentle stroll. As for the hotel, I was more than happy with it, but there were niggles. Very clean; very personable English-speaking staff and good, albeit expensive food. Permanent uniformed security at the door and you have to use your room card to make the elevators work. Sound practice for an international hotel in an embassy district, not cause for paranoia. The centre of Berlin is as safe as any city I've ever visited. Rooms are a decent size for Europe. Lots of storage for all but the most fanatical shopper or overloaded businessman; in-room safe; plenty of power outlets. Bathroom had shower/bath and was a fine size. Ice machine on every floor. Can't speak for the views because I was on the inside, looking across at another wing. 24-hour room service. I ordered a steak at eleven one night, which arrived in 25 minutes, and my in-room breakfast the next morning was there bang-on the appointed time. If your television's important you'll be disappointed; it's a big old box, not an LED or plasma, but it has CNN/BBC/Bloomberg and the other usual suspects. The health club in the sub-basement is quite small and has fewer machines than I'd expected, but was never that busy while I was there. You reach it via a dedicated elevator at the rear of each floor; follow the signs posted at the main elevators from the lobby. The lobby is a nice place to while away an hour if it's quiet and the restaurant is worth at least one visit. I enjoyed my steak but never felt tempted to go for the wagyu beef because unless I'm entertaining a desperately important client, if I charge my company for a steak that cost €390 a kilo I get thrown out of a window. Downsides : well, it's a Marriott so they haven't heard of free wifi yet; remove anything from the minibar for longer than 15 seconds and it's charged to your bill, and the prices for the minibar are silly, to put it mildly. Yes, those are the prices most hotels of this standard charge in most capital cities, and if you work for Goldman Sachs you don't care, but unless I'm totally desperate I refuse to pay €3.50 for a small bottle of water or a small can of Coke, so I recommend a trip across to the Kaiser's or Lidl supermarkets in the shopping centre on Potsdamer Platz and make liberal use of the ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “Fun visit in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: French S
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Berlin. We are so glad that we chose to come here. The Marriott was a great hotel in a very good location. Our room was very comfortable and the restaurant was excellent. The breakfast buffet had every thing imaginable on it and very good. We also had dinner which was very good. A little pricy, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location!”
Reviews.Author: sasha o
Reviews.Content: Located right in the middle of Berlin, 2 min walk to the sony centre and about 20 min walk to the Bundaberg gate etc, train station and bus 5 min walk. Zoo in Berlin is really good very big you can take the 200 bus right across the road from the Marriott to it. Lobby in the hotel was very nice and had a smokers lounge too, restaurant (the midtown grill) done lovely food but was very very expensive. Pool was very small and freezing cold so didn’t really use it. Rooms were standard good size, beds were really comfortable, and only down fall was the t.v had no English channels. would stay here again staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room nice location”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Berlin film festival . The rooms are clean, carpet spotless, quiet and cozy. It's freezing outside but the temperature inside the room is warm although I prefer Bit cooler so I opened the windows. The ladies at the reception are nice and so are the bellboys. The concierge guy at the desk never smiles but did what I requested him to do. Not the friendly kind. Outside is a chinese restaurant and a coffee shop so very convenient. Hotel very near the train station and there is even a small convenient store inside the station . Sony center steps away with theaters, restaurants and dunkin donuts with wifi at two euro an hour. Cross the street and you will find a mall and a few restaurants. Take the train and go to kadewe dept store and you can find almost anything. Don't forget to get tax rebate from the store. The whole street near kadewe is good for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “BERLIN WHAT A PLACE”
Reviews.Author: SYMANGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, the Hotel is top end and spot on. The rooms are clean and good bed. You could not ask for a better location, right in the heart of Berlin. Transport right outside the Hotel, Berlin card for 6 euro lets you use bus,train,tram, u band fantastic value. Berlin Wall, Brand Gate, Sony Centre short walk. We also visited the Zoo best in Europe, You will enjoy this hotel and location is spot on. Xmass market right outside the hotel, best in germany hot bratty and cold German beer, cant beat it. I will be going back next year

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from business hotels”
Reviews.Author: sabecketttt
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, with well-though desk providing good work space and easy connectivity. Service was excellent, both at check-in and at check-out. Great breakfast - wealth of options, though at 30 eur you might want to 'buy half a bakery', if not included in the room price. Location is perfect for both sight seeing and for business travels. P.S. try the cocktails at the Catwalk bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ZT100
Reviews.Content: As always with Marriott, expect a great hotel in a great location. The staff are friendly, the facilities first class and the rooms spacious and comfortable, especially the beds.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mammyof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a long week-end in January. The location was great - very central, just beside the Sony Centre at Potsdamer Platz. The room was very comfortable and a good size for a big-city hotel. For an American hotel chain, I was disappointed at the choice of TV channels - a non-news English channel would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott EVER”
Reviews.Author: OscarTwinCities
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Marriott is the best Marriott Hotel that we have ever stayed at. It is very new, and, of course, spotless. The staff was most friendly and welcoming. And, it has the BEST executive lounge we has ever used. Incredible array of starters, salads, entrees and deserts. And, full complementary cocktail and wine and beer bar. Go before they decide it is too expensive and cut it all back!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Berlin's sites”
Reviews.Author: hhkexplorer
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in room 708 - with great views over the city towards the Berliner Dom. Room was comfortably sized, very clean and well kept. The beds were quite comfortable and the bathroom was very large for a European hotel. Reception was quick and efficient as usual for Marriott properties. The lobby area of the hotel is wide open, making the public areas of the hotel very bright and airy. Location of this hotel is the best feature, 2 minute walk from Potsdamer Platz in one direction and about a 5-10 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate in the other direction. Also about 10 minute walk to Gendarmenmarkt. Early morning cab ride had us to Tegel in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I love to use this network of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: I love to use this network of hotels, always surprise me, of course, positive. Every time you visit the Mariot hotel I can say the same thing. Perosnel nice, really help, knowing English, rooms very clean and well equipped. We know the only downside is bigger price here, but it is proportional to what we get. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: msouza23
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with my family (2 kids and my wife) for a long weekend in Berlin at the Marriott, service was in overall great, the room was spacious and they were extremely nice with my kids in overall but specially during breakfast (when my younger was not exactly behaving that well...).

Reviews.Title: “Spot on hotel in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: anotherhotelreview
Reviews.Content: We chose the Berlin Marriott as a base to explore the city over a long weekend in December. The hotel was very easy to find and conveniently placed for visiting all parts of the city in a very safe and welcoming area. The hotel is modern, fresh and airy. Our room was large and comfortable with the excellent Marriott bed. The bathroom was also large with good facilities. Although we had booked on a room only basis, we are Gold Rewards members so had access to the executive lounge. This lounge is situated on the top floor and is well equipped for drinks, breakfast, snacks through the day and a wide selection of light evening dishes. In addition in the evening there is a wide selection of beer, wine and some spirits. This was one of the best Marriott Exec Lounges we have ever used. The girls working in there for very hard working and were really helpful. After spending our days sightseeing around the cities various sights and Christmas Markets it was a treat to relax in the lounge on an evening. Rather exhausted after lots of walking we decided to make use of the complimentary food and drink each evening as the selection was excellent. The hotel has lots of shops, bars and some entertainment on its doorstep. It also has been built on the line were the Berlin Wall stood which was quite interesting. The Bahn (underground system) has a large modern station right next to the hotel. A comfortable five minute walk took you to the Brandenburg Gate, so you can see how easy and central this hotel is for easily getting around the city. The Marriott has a swimming pool and fitness area for guests which was being refurbished whilst we visited I think this will be a real bonus for guests visiting. For a capital city we found rates to be quite reasonable with good promotions available on the Marriott website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravele33045
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and amenities. The metro is just outside of the hotel entrance. Museum is land is in easy walking distance. Lots of restaurants and shops nearly. The metro is easy to use and gives access to the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: Tootbelle
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out we had nothing but a great stay. Alp handled the bags...we arrived after a 14 hours plane flight..the room had a great view....executive level provided all the food and drink we would want...wonderful tub for a soak. Everyone helpful with directions and ideas. Dinner reservations? Nothing to it! Just ask Christian. Very well located. Easy walking to the many historic sights, Brandenberg Gate, memorials everywhere and the Tiergarten. We enjoyed the Christmas Markets that were within easy walking distance. A walking tour, including a portion of the wall and Checkpoint Charlie, steps from the door. It was our home away from home. Oh! The bed was dreamy!

Reviews.Title: “solid choice”
Reviews.Author: grommit22
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online through a discount hotel site and were very happy with the outcome. This hotel is central to Brandenburg Gate, the Tiergarten, WWII sites and the U-Bahn. The quality of the hotel was excellent and the service was great. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: FennyG77
Reviews.Content: We like the room, it is cosy and perfect as we have taken 6 hours train and was so tired and it was perfect for us. We arrived late, we could still find restaurant nearby, christmas market as it is so near to Potzdamer Platz which is great. Everyone is friendly and the breakfast is great. Great service and recommended hotel for all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stews_Girl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lovely and its really well situated near to Potzdamer platz. The hotel has a unique character all of its own. Our room was really spacious with a king bed, the bathroom was lovely with nice toiletries. The only thing that let the hotel down was that my husband requested a feather free room as I have an allergy to feathers, when we arrived he checked with the girl who was checking us in and she said the room was feather free, however when we went to the room and we checked the pillows were goose feather and the quilt duck down! We notified them at 15:30 in the afternoon and we were off out for several hours so the girl on reception we reported it to said she would get it sorted, however when we came back 4.5 hours later it still hadn't been done, so I phoned housekeeping and requested the bedding be changed and another hour went by and still nothing got done so in the end I had to go down to reception to ask them to sort it out as we'd been up since 4:30 am and wanted to go to bed and by this time it was turned 10pm anyway after reception phoned housekeeping, within 10 mins of me getting back to the room the chap knocked the door and gave us pillows but no duvet, so we asked about the duvet being changed too and he said he didn't know if they had a non allergenic one, so he went to check and came back a few mins later with one, but he just gave it to us he didn't change the bed for us! The location was fantastic, if you are room only, there is a starbucks on the corner where you can get nice coffee and a bacon and egg ciabatta its also 700m to the Brandanburg Gate you are also in walking distance of many other places including the site of hitlers bunker, the berlin wall and the Topography of Terror musuem which is free. The Station is near by and the tube and also tour buses go from just up the road. We did the CityCircle tour as it takes you to more places than any of the others, we got a 2 day pass for 20 euro's which was fantastic value as you could hop on and off at any of the stops. Also the commentry is recorded in many languages so you just select your language and they give you headphones to listen to it. We visited for the Christmas markets which were lovely there was even a small one just up the road from the hotel. The sony centre is nice and there are some lovely restaurants inside. Also you can do the panorama where you go to the top of the building that looks a bit like the flat iron building in New York but its only 24 floors and it has the fastest lift which takes you to the top in 2.5 seconds! The views on a clear day are amazing I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds and an awesome breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lolainlondon
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times over the last few years and although the hotel itself is not really that noteworthy, there are several things about it that stick out to me. 1. the location is extremely convenient. it's about a less than 1 minute walk to potsdamer platz, there are cafes and restaurants nearby for a quick bite. 2. The beds are truly amazing. As in put your head down and you fall immediately asleep amazing 3. The pancakes taste like heaven. True american style pancakes. Best part is that breakfast is served til 3 on the weekends. Other than that the new renovation is quite nice, and the rooms are quite comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy comfort in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: We read previous good reviews on here and were not disappointed - this hotel is a real home away from home in the heart of Berlin It's located by Potsdamer Platz square and tube system but it's so central we walked everywhere - it's really near the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie and the Reichstag in particular. Berlin is a great city to visit - especially with Christmas markets on now - but its 20th century history is just so important you should not miss the Topography of Terror on the history of the Nazis and the Checkpoint Charlie Haus detailing the escapees over the Berlin Wall. The hotel was so warm and cosy in Berlin's chilly winter. The executive lounge is probably the best we've ever had. We managed a full meal off its evening nibbles service one night, and often enjoyed coming back in for a coffee and cake to rest our chilly bones during the day's sightseeing. We had a huge corner room with great views up the city streets and a massive warm bathroom with great big shower cubicle. it's adjacent to the Ritz Carlton but half the price with very little difference to show for it in our opinion Best of all though was the Midtown Grill restaurant. WOW. It served fabulous soft steaks, rich glasses of wine, lovely bread and dips as a pre starter and gave us marshmallows to toast with our bill! Truly a blow out indulgent meal and really good value. We would definitely return - a great hotel and friendly helpful staff who all speak excellent English - highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hbb1504
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in December 2011 and had no complaints whatsoever. The hotel is very convenient to get to from the TXL airport (bus to Zoologischer Garten and the U2 to Potsdamer Platz. Also, its a great base to explore the city. Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Tiergartern, Victory Colum, Unter den lieben and the Holocaust Memorial are all within easy walking distance from the hotel. Plus there are lots of restaurants around Postdamer Platz making it easy to get breakfast and dinner. The rooms are clean, quiet, well - sized... cant fault this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SaliB
Reviews.Content: I have to concur with what other reviewers are saying about the location of this hotel. Easy walking distance to the Brandenburg Gate, portions of the infamous Wall, Checkpoint Charlie and also loads of shopping and restaurants and cafes. Marriott standards are adhered to as well. All in all we had a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Levi G
Reviews.Content: great location, close to many sights. Staff is friendly and the beds in the room are so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Yeswhere
Reviews.Content: I spent two days in Berlin and was invited to this hotel by client. Service was very "german" (i.e.: efficient, not too many smiles). Pool was very relaxing. Breakfast yummy. Dressing rooms at pool a little "smelly". Was invited to free WIFI by cute assistant, but I heard other clients complained about price. Air conditioning in rooms was noisy. Instructions not clear.Check out was fast.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !”
Reviews.Author: katydaly_11
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by this hotel and its excellent central location. Made our stay thouroughly enjoyable. Can't fault the staff who were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best of It's Kind to Remember”
Reviews.Author: saradopoylosm
Reviews.Content: I had to stay 2 nights at this Hotel for Business purposes. I connected to the wi-fi from my room signing-up with all my 3 devices. They charged me 3x19,95 euros for the same day!!!! When I asked the front desk to complain to her manager, the manager just tell her to make a "discount" charging me 2x19,95 euros. As it is by far the most expensive rateIi have ever paid for 24 hours of internet access, I will always share this negative experience with all my friends and colleagues!

Reviews.Title: “The location is great”
Reviews.Author: ort s
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good. A great benefit of this hotel. It helped us a lot during our stay in Berlin. Rooms are ok , clean and nice , good bed at the room. We will come again to the hotel , rate of room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritneyNorthGermany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located and we enjoyed many aspects of out stay. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the personnel are excellent and there's a nice atmosphere throughout. However, I would say it is a very good 4 star hotel and not a 5 star hotel. The bedrooms are spacious and welcoming but a bathroom with a cheap looking shower over the bath that was impossible to stand under and a plastic shower curtain shouldn't exist in such a hotel. The breakfast was sufficient but not spectacular. The breafast room was relatively small and therefore it quickly filled up and became rather noisy. On our arrival we found the hotel car park full so were directed to the multistorey opposite. Make sure you pay for this at reception and not at the ticket machines in the car park - 18 hours cost 32 Euros! But to be fair to the hotel, they refunded the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BianchiRoadie
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room. Concierge lounge was out of this world. So much better than in the US. Hotel has a great location close to sights, parks and restaurants. Brandenberg Gate and Holocaust Memorial just a 5 minute walk. Used my Marriott points so i can't comment on cost, but would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: Bombur
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel primarily for location. We were only going to be in the city for a couple of days, so were limiting ourselves to a central area. The area felt very safe for walking at night - many nice restaurants and the Tiergarten a block away. We especially appreciated the great location near the Potzdamer Platz transportation station. The hotel was comfortable and our requests were quickly met. The room was large and the bed was extremely comfortable. We used room service several times and it was prompt and the food was very good and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and wonderfully located”
Reviews.Author: andreamonte
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as good as all the Marriott's hotel I've been are. Nothing less. The executive floor where we were admitted gaters a business room with wide screen I-mac, and a reserved breakfast room with a fantastic view over downtown Berlin, and food no-stop from 6pm to 12pm. Rooms are very good and quiet, service is ok, but the best of the hotel is the location, leterally outside the U-bahn, Deutsche Bahn and S-bahn Postdamer Platz station, and the Brandeburg Gate and the Reichstag are 5 minutes far walking. All the major touristic attractions are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: Holta_O
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in one the the best areas of Berlin. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The executive lounge was one of the best I have been in. It had great food, nice German beer, rich breakfast. The rooms were clean, the gym was nice and the pool and sauna also.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Postos
Reviews.Content: Very Nice hotel but the weekness point is the most expensive wifi internet ever!

Reviews.Title: “New. Super service. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: 613Daniel
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Close to U-Bahn. We even walked to the Museum-Island one day. All of the staff was very courteous and helpful. Yes, all of them that we encountered in the reception, the gym, the concierge, the cleaning staff, and the young men carrying suitcases. All were well-trained and very professional. The room was new with a very big modern bathroom. The elevators are very fast up and down on the ten floors. There were many business people and conferences. That was not disturbing. After having stayed in Marriotts all over Europe, USA and other countries, this hotel had one surprise. We were there from a Tuesday until Sunday. The executive club was used by many families with many many children from 1--15 years old. That is also pleasant but not when they are crawling and playing in the area of where the food is and being served. I will not recommend this hotel to my friends who want to do business in Berlin and are used to other Exec. Clubs in Marriott Hotels. By the way, the food and the soups and the drinks in the executive club in the morning and evening and the servers deserve 10 stars. (In our opinion the two young girls need assistance in the ex. club. It is simply too much work for two people. But they were always very pleasant and working at high speed.) The gym and swimming pool and sauna were new and clean. A great added pleasure. We recommend this hotel and hope that the management will clarify this issue about the use of the executive club as a business club or a family club.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Rawlpluks
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids aged 6 and 8. First time in Berlin for an extended weekend break, by car, from Denmark. Before deciding I had looked at a lot of different options including different apartments but due to prices going up between 2- and 300 euros pr night i decided to call a few 5 star hotels (with a pool for the kids) to compare. The marriot had a nice offer of an executive room on the 10th floor with lounge at a cost of about 270 euro pr night. This included an extended continental breakfast also served in the lounge. Arrival was easy, parking is 24 euros pr night and is in the hotel basement, as we mostly used the U-bahn we left the car there for most of the stay (parking can be hard to find and our GPS was dated and often wrong!). Check in was uneventful, if perhaps a little devoid of charm. The room was nice, 2 double beds, one for the kids and one for the adults and a nice view over the old east berlin with the TV tower. Hotel is right on/next to Potsdammer platz and a 2 min walk from the holocaust memorial, Richstag and Brandenburger Tor. The area is not the most charming but a good central base to explore from, within easy reach of all the areas of berlin. A bit more detail on the executive lounge is needed. It was 2 doors from our room and a great addition for us (room 1052). After breakfast there is a continious serving throughout the day and in the afternoon/evening you can get small dishes, more than enough for an evening meal. The result for us was that we would have a very good breakfast, explore till late afternoon and then return to the hotel. We would then go to the lounge for coffee and hot chocolade, perhaps a beer. The kids would use the pool and the adults the gym in the room next to the pool. We would be back up in the room around 20.00 and the kids would be tired and NOT interested in going out to a restaurent. THAT was when the lounge was spot on. For more than 3 evenings (no more than 2 really) it is not recommended as you tire from the food choices but for 3 days in Berlin is a very good choice if you travel with young kids and are not looking for a night on the town. There is a cocktail bar on site, but, we did not try it. Buttom line, great hotel for a first time weekend/short stay in Berlin esp. if you have young children.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Arcticozzie
Reviews.Content: Family trip. Great hotel. Profession Staff only to pleased to help. Location is in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite Excellent”
Reviews.Author: grimrater
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the Marriott group of Hotels.This Hotel is well located, the many reasons are already mentioned in previous reviews. The whole area has been rebuilt showcasing some amazing architecture. In fact, if you're interested in modern architecture then a trip to Berlin should be on your 'bucket list'. Our room was on the executive lounge floor. The lounge was fantastic, a lovely selection of food and drinks were there each day. I find it disappointing when no in room tea/coffee making facilities are available. Silly really! We loved Berlin, my husband and I stayed for 4 nights and didn't think it was long enough to do justice to the city. We'd go back for another visit. So, as I said I'm a fan of Marriotts...then why wouldn't I go back here? I think the reason is...It's clinical!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star but definitely not 5 star luxury.”
Reviews.Author: jdanielca
Reviews.Content: A 5 star would be the Ritz carlton maybe if it is anything like other Ritz Carlton's I have stayed at. I would not say this is a luxury 5 star hotel. I would rate this at a very good 4 star. It is not better than say, for example the Westin Harbour Castle Toronto. In fact that is a 4 star and this is definitely not up to that standard so where it gets to say it is 5 star is beyond me. I can provide more examples but I think you guys get the idea. Paid 100 USD plus fees and taxes per night from priceline. Wifi was an extra 19 Euros, they offered to upgrade to a bigger room which includes wifi for 25 Euros. So for 6 Euros more why not. The room was bigger but probably because it was a handicap access room. It was huge though, I'll give them that. Over all was very clean, very decent, but I would not say 5 star. For the money I paid it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place-Fine Location”
Reviews.Author: chapmack
Reviews.Content: We spent two night here on our trip to Berlin this summer. It is located in a great place near lots of restaurants, pubs and the DB train station in Potsdamer Platz. It was easy to locate the hotel coming up from the station. We were given access to the executive lounge as my husband is a Gold Rewards member. They had several snacks and drinks all complimentary throughout the day. Even when we returned late after 10 PM the lounge was still open offering wine and cheese snacks which was appreciated. The front desk staff were very knowledgable, friendly and professional. There is also a great bar attached to the hotel which serves exceptional drinks and for the atmosphere and caliber of drinks quite reasonably priced. You can get anywhere from this location since you are so close to the DB train station with the U Bahn and S Bahn stops right our the door. Many restaurants to walk to and bars as well. Rooms are typical upscale Marriott with comfortable beds and nice bathroom ammenities. Wi-Fi is free in the executive lounge, so we didn't need access in the guestroom. We had an early train to catch, but there were taxis waiting right outside the door to take us to the main train station less than a ten minute ride. We will definetly return to Berlin and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: anna z
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very conveniently. Almost across the street is Sony Center am Postdamer Plats - it's fantastic modern architecture and respect for the architecture of the past. Once inside, the dome, you feel yourself in the future that we see in movies J. In 5-7 minutes walk Brandenburg Gate, about 7-10 minutes and can reach up to the Bundestag. So it is very convenient location for walking. The hotel itself is, as always - beautiful, clean and comfortable. Underground parking. Internet fee, but in Executive Lounge Internet access (wifi) is free. Sports club, though this time it was not possible to go down workout. Rooms - a classic case - as in all Marriott comfortable beds, pillows and blankets. Furnished in the style of those times when the hotel was built, but still in excellent condition. Breakfast classic - a buffet with a full set of all necessary products for a good start a good day.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - great location”
Reviews.Author: Mostowich
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Marriott in Berlin to attend the Marathon. The hotel has been great - staff friendly and helpful. The workout room is small - cross trainers and treadmills - some weights. Could use more equipment for the upper body. Serious workout people would be disappointed. The really great thing about this hotel is its location - walking distance to almost everything. Countless shopping / dining options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great spa, good service...”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityMaria
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, no complaints really! Location was perfect, great pool, free internet, free breakfast, nice sized rooms, chocolate in rooms...

Reviews.Title: “a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: ITJylland
Reviews.Content: A weekend trip to Berlin was an exciting experience and we mannaged to "run" through Berlin in one and a half day. Our stay was at the Marriott hotel and we had a fantastic room with a ´view over Berlin, the room was the Marriott standard and as allways it was a fantastic bed and well furnitured room. the excecutive lounge was at the top and it was well served with all our needings. my highest recomandations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pedalmom
Reviews.Content: After 9 days in Germany, staying in a couple different apartments with our family, it was pleasant to end our trip with a night in an "American" hotel. This Marriott was very conveniently located right across from the Potsdamer Platz train station. We were surprised at how large the rooms were, given the central location in a major city. We had access to the excellent Executive Lounge, which had a nice selection of food throughout the day, as well as free drinks. Some nice touches, like a plate of chocolate truffles in each room, were welcome surprises. Since there was a thunderstorm the night we stayed there, we stayed in and ate in the hotel's steak restaurant and had wonderful meals. A fun treat at the end was that the bill came with a little fire pot to roast marshmallows and dip them in chocolate! Our teenagers really enjoyed this hotel as a conclusion to our visit to Germany.

Reviews.Title: “In a perfect spot for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Taintor
Reviews.Content: In an ideal spot-Brandenburg Gate, Parliament building within a 5 minute walk. Transport nearby. Breakfast excellent and staff in general all friendly. Only negative comment - no one helped us with our luggage which you always get in this class of hotel and if you want tea and coffee making facilites in your room it is 10 euros a day. I have never ever in all my travels had to pay for this in a 5 star hotel. We were allowed to borrow a kettle and cups though free of charge. Also booked in advance for an allergy free room. This request wasn't met and I had to ask for all the bedding to be changed. Was a bit annoyed with this to be honest. Do visit the zoo and if you have time Potsdam. Well worth it. Excellent restaurants nearby-Cancun across the road and the American Sports bar Play Off in the Arkaden centre. Food great. Corroboreen in the Sony Centre-food and service when we went was awful. Great city for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Location, service,breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: gvmnt
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed a 2 night stay here at the start of our German Holiday, and would definitely stay again. The hotel is lovely (the pool is perhaps a bit cold, but our kids didn't seem to mind too much). The location is phenomenal - walking distance to almost anything you could want. great restaurants in the area, and the breakfast was divine. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a top hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: RobsterWirral
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth looking at if you want a visit to Berlin. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are emaculate. The breakfasts are outstanding with the best selection you will see for the price !!!! Rob.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Towels!”
Reviews.Author: Hope774
Reviews.Content: Towels are so nice and fresh here! That was an excellent stay. I want to recommend this to anyone. They are also very eco-friendly and ask if you want your towels changed or if you can use them again the next day! Love it but a little bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JCC020
Reviews.Content: As a first timer to Berlin one wonders where to stay: the Berlin Marriott is smack in the middle of everything just off Postdamer Platz, on a walkable distance to almost everything you want to see and visit. Hotel is as to expect from a Marriott: very comfortable. Executive lounge serves excellent breakfast, as well as drinks and snacks later during the day. Check-in and -out went smoothly and efficient. Definitely a place to come back to when returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_Marcela
Reviews.Content: A great Marriott. Central. New. Clean. What more could you want - even has Sky TV !! The lift froze on us - but they had us out within 10 minutes. The food is nouveau cuisine - so ask for bigger portions. Opposite is Starbucks - go there for free Wi-Fi !! We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kalevet
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in Potsdamer Platz. Easy to find from the UBahn. The reception were very friendly and helpful - always helped us with a smile which was nice. They even went out of their way to find out opening times for the Sony Centre for us (even though we could have easily walked across the road to get there! A rare lazy moment for us) Our room was large - there was 3 people staying in one room and we had enough space even with two double beds. Bathroom was clean and was enough space for us. Didn't get to check out the gym or pool downstairs but one of my party did and said it was small but it was good enough to have a light workout. There was an old TV in the room (i.e not flat screen) which was a little odd furthermore we couldn't get it to work. That didn't bother us much as we didn't go to Berlin to watch TV. The location is just brilliant. Easy reach for restaurants, tourist attraction (Brandenburg Tor, Sony Centre, Tiergarten, Checkpoint Charlie, Holocaust Memorial etc etc) were within 10 min or less walk to the hotel. I would definitely would visit the Marriott in Berlin again. As mention before, it is more suited for business stay but I don't see why normal tourists wouldn't want to stay here either. Also, please can they make the Wi-Fi free? I've been at 3 star hotels that have free Wi-Fi. It was far too expensive to buy.

Reviews.Title: “the best lounge ever”
Reviews.Author: caroline278
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Berlin Marriott. What a great hotel. The location is top. Right at the Potsdammer Platz, the new exciting shopping, dining and nightlife destination in Berlin. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is beautiful, check in was a breeze and our room on the 8th floor was up to Marriott standards. But the absolute best part was the executive lounge on the 10th floor. In the first place they serve the best breakfast we have ever had in a lounge and it even is way better than a lot of regular breakfast buffets. But as an extra they serve a dinner/snack buffet every night. If you wanted to you would not have to go out for dinner, cause you have an excellent meal here. Lots of small dishes to choose from, every nigth a different soup and a pasta dish. And to top it off some really nice deserts. The lounge is open in weekends as well. As gold members we had free access to the lounge, but even if you have to pay extra to stay on the executive floors I think it is well worth the money. But even without the lounge this is a very nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Excellent Historic Location”
Reviews.Author: glennr2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Berlin Marriott on a group tour and were nearly completely satisfied. The hotel is located in the resurrected Potsdamer Platz, adjacent to where the Berlin Wall and the Death Strip were located. We were a short walk from the Brandenburg Gate, The Tiergarten and Under den Linden. The locations that were not within walking distance were easily accessible from the Potsdamer Platz U-bahn station. The Marriott is large and modern and my only complaint is that like most American luxury chains, it charges for internet service. In a time when wireless internet is as common as television, air-conditioning, water and electricity in hotel rooms, charging for the service is a practice that European chains and mid-level American chains have long since abandoned. The public areas of the hotel were attractive and comfortable and the atrium gives it an open, airy atmosphere. The breakfast buffet was large and had a nice selection of hot and cold items. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: WellWornPassport
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near Potsdamerplatz, and easily accessible by public transportation. The Sony Center is nearby, and offers a number of restaurant options. The rooms are very comfortable and the executive lounge offers a nice spread at cocktail hour. The service was excellent. My bags never made it to Berlin, but the staff was incredibly helpful in assisting me by helping to track down my luggage and directing me to the best places to shop. I had meetings to attend, and the receptionist couldn't find a tailor who could perform alterations with quick turnaround, and so she called one of her personal friends to perform the alterations...and she (and her friend) refused to accept payment! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerfromnc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights after spending the previous week in Rome, Italy. This hotel and our large room was a refreshing change from the small room we had in Rome. The hotel lobby is large, contemporary, and very well decorated and there are many places to sit, have coffee, relax, etc.... Our room was a superior room and was quite large and had a wall of windows with a city view. The bathroom was very large with a tub and separate shower. The dual shower heads/rainshower was great. On our first day while we were out the hotel delivered a very beautifully displayed plate of macaroons to our room which was a very nice gift that was unexpected. Our room had turndown service, chocolates on the pillows...all that lovely stuff. I will say my boyfriend was not fond of the mattress and found it uncomfortable but I didn't mind it. The workout room/spa was very nice - very beautiful indoor pool and a full locker room with sauna. The "catwalk" bar is very trendy and a nice place to hangout - although the drinks were quite expensive. The only downside is we were there for such a short time we did not get to fully enjoy everything the hotel has to offer. It's also in a great location with easy access to the S and U trains. Walking distance to the Sony center with restaurant options and many cafes and bars nearby. I would certainly stay at the Marriott Berlin again if I have the opportunity and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying here when in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MDTravProf
Reviews.Content: I am in Berlin 1-2 times per year. I love staying at this hotel for its location and comfort. It is located right by the Potsdamer Platz making it easily accessible to most everything Berlin has to offer. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet. It has everything you want for either business or vacation travel. The staff are topnotch and willing to help you out with just about anything. I forgot my phone charger and one of the staff members located one that I could use and lent it to me for the duration of my stay. I look forward to staying here again in November.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: patswamber
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in June. We used points for two of our nights and paid for 2 additional. We were very fortunate to be upgraded to the concierge floor upon arrival. Our stay was relaxing and we enjoyed all of the food and services offered in the lounge. My daughter loved the pool and the nearby Sony center where we were able to sit outside and people watch while we ate. While we did a lot of walking, taxi's are always readily available if you need one. Pros: location, the front desk staff, amazingly comfy beds, healthclub, private lounge and indoor pool were all better than expected. Walking distance to many sites as well as restaurants, trains and shops. All staff we encountered were lovely and helpful, we appreciated their recommendations regarding nearby restaurants and events Cons: The lobby was very quiet and more geared for business meetings. It didn't really have a family or fun vibe. I would recommend moving the concierge desk toward reception, expanding the map and pamphlet materials and being more 'visible to guest entering the hotel. Also, the fee for wireless internet is excessive. Tips: There's a fantastic german restaurant called Alt-Berliner in walking distance to the hotel. Food and Service were wonderful, they have outdoor seating and a few English menus. Overrated: Don't bother taking the hop on-hop-off bus tour. The walking and bike tours are much better and you learn more

Reviews.Title: “Big fan of Marriott, but not this one.”
Reviews.Author: khanhkim
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time and loyal customer of Marriott so I expected the same great service out of the Berlin Marriott. The people at the front desk and cafe were just fine. They were polite, helpful, and efficient. However, when posing questions of requests from the concierge, the trouble began. We asked him if we could have any information on Potsdam because we were headed out there for the day. He showed us which trains to take (which was not what I asked) and when I asked for any maps of Potsdam themselves he very rudely and curtly told me that had the maps when I got there. He was extremely dismissive and rude. The next day we came back to pick up luggage we had left behind to go to the airport. I told the front desk guy that we had 3 pieces of luggage. He gave me one then turned around and walked off to help another customer. I had to wait in line and ask someone else to get my other two bags and we almost missed our train. The actual hotel is quite nice. The rooms were perfect and the location is very close to all the action. We enjoyed our visit but were turned off by just a couple of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location on erstwhile berlin wall .. will be back..”
Reviews.Author: Samjo24
Reviews.Content: Berlin airport looked small. They are contsructing a new one , I am told. Hotel was 30 mins drive from airport. It is situated in an area which is a new suburb, located in no mans territory during the erstwhile East west divide by Berlin wall. Area now rocks. Brandenburg gate is walking distance from hotel. so is HOLOCAUST MEMORIAL. Rooms to Marriot standard. Breakfast speread was superb. The dense forest nearby provided perfect opportunity for morning jog. Area is surrounded by various embassies. Could see canadian one from hotel Window. Marriots world over are to the same standard and this one was no exception. Location is huge huge plus though.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION & FRIENDLY RECEPTION”
Reviews.Author: liora4658
Reviews.Content: You would battle to find a better location than the Marriott for sightseeing. Right on the Potsdamer Platz, walking distance to Brandenburg Gate and museums, and public transport. Big thank you to Olaf in reception and his manager Jens, for their friendly and professional assistance. Our room was spacious and clean. Sadly though, there is no free WiFi in the hotel at all, not even in the lounge, and breakfast is not included in the room rate. The hotel breakfast at 30EURO p.p. was really excessive and we needed to go out to a nearby Starbucks for breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Small Annoyances”
Reviews.Author: cobmw
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay. Clean, modern rooms. Helpful staff. Great location. A few small annoyances. Splurged on a separate room for my teenager. Then found out it is impossible to disable the adult movies without also loosing all movies and the mini bar and the phone. Shower water changes temperature randomly. Parking garage has narrow isles. But more trouble is the exit. They have disabled the basement pay kiosk (perhaps to discourage non-guest parking?) so you must go to the front desk and wait in line to pay each time you leave. I complained so they gave me a "permanent" pass. Except several times the pass was kaput. Now I get to ask people behind me to back up while I park and treck to front desk. Maddening.

Reviews.Title: “Average with above average price.”
Reviews.Author: fogetmylogin
Reviews.Content: Nothing big to complain about but didn't exceed expectations. The Room was a bit stuffy and the AC system was the too much or not enough variety. Service good, but not great. Long wait at Check-out. As is standard with Marriott anything not included is charged at obscene prices. e.g 32 Euros for Breakfast (which was good), 20 Euros a day for Internet. The location is central, close to lots of sights with good transport links, but you could do better as a tourist with something further east, for example the Radisson Blu next to Musuem Island and not far from Alexander Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and Marriott Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: stalenbu
Reviews.Content: the Hotel is ofcourse in a great location right on Potsdamer Platz with metro and S Bahn on walking distance. Wakling also to Brandenburger Gate, Reichstag, Alex and Checkpoint Charly as well as the Wall museum. The Rooms were good, with all you need. We loved the executive lounge with the food, however I must say it got very busy at the weekend but the staff remained very friendly. Very clean Hotel in general and as I mentioned friendly staff. Parking was a little of a challange but we managed at the end

Reviews.Title: “Location to most everything”
Reviews.Author: Pointe-Claire
Reviews.Content: As one would expect from a Marriott, a clean, comfortable and pleasant hotel. The multi-lingual staff are courteous, helpful, and attentive. Close approximity to dining, with the Sony Center around the corner; steps from Potsdamer Platz and the Berlin business district. Of course, one is also central to several historical sites, including Brandenburg Gate, and of course, the Wall. However, two suggestions: get curtains that can actually close; and consider complimentary internet access.. The bottom line: A comfortable stay, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kara79
Reviews.Content: The hotel was less than 5 min from the train station which made it very convenient to walk to the hotel with our suitcases. It also had a Vapiano's, Starbucks, Subway, right next door. Brandenburg Gate, Holocaust Memorial again were less than 10 min away. Check point Charlie was farther out, but walkable. About 20 min. They opened up a new outdoor museum last year for the wall which was really neat to read about. We did not use the pool and weight room but did see them. They looked great, just no time to relax on our site seeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “good amenities but awful service”
Reviews.Author: Gigi_gva
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location near from everything (10 min walk to brandenburg tor). The indoor pool is not very big but ok. Sauna is nice and relaxing after a day of sightseeing. The beds are very comfy and the building is very calm. The room was clean. BUT : internet is very expensive (19.90 EUR/day) and is linked only to one device. I paid 39.80 EUR /day because I connected my Iphone and Ipad to the wifi! I complained to the receptionist and she told me it was the system and nothing could be undone! Good service. So the hotel is good but don't expect too much from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: julphil
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott, clean and great comfortable beds. But the location is excellent, right near Brandenburg Gate, the Jewish Memorial and Potsdam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, incredibly unattentive concierge, no free internet”
Reviews.Author: AnaTBall
Reviews.Content: Usually, I am a fan of Marriott Hotels because they are usually well located, well maintained, clean, good service and reasonably priced. This one is no exception except for whom we nicknamed Mr. No, the concierge. It became almost a joke. Everything we asked for, his first response was NO. At first he didn't even try to soften the blow, offer alternatives, etc. until I told him the last day "I knew you were going to say no" which took him by surprise and made the effort to help us with our requirement (renting some bikes). Other than that, it is a very good hotel with extremely comfortable beds and very clean. Location is perfect, within walking distance of the Sony Center and the Brandenburg Gate. Internet access is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookingglass101
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, nice hotel Staff was nice and spoke many languages Good Location, walking distance to sites and food and cabs were always available On site food (restaurant, lounge) was good. Cons: Price: was very pricey Some construction: In Nov 2010, there was some construction going that was annoying during the day if you were in the room. A tip, their executive lounge is very nice (free food and drinks), if you can gain access to it, do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the internet.”
Reviews.Author: myc888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for 3 nights on our first trip to Berlin and chose the Marriott for its central location, and was not disappointed. To get to the hotel from Schonefeld Airport, I recommend taking the airport express to Friedrichstraße and then an S-Bahn to Potsdamer Platz which will save you around 40mins than on the other lines.The S-bahn station is just across the road which takes you to most of the tourist attractions. We mainly chose to use the U-bahn, which was a 3 minute walk from the hotel as this seemed to be more reliable and required no line changes. Check in was smooth and we were given an 8th floor room which was large and next to the lifts. A bit disappointed with our large CRT TV which only had very limited English channels, and in a way expected a little more from a 5* hotel chain. The only gripe I had with this hotel was the internet ----> there is no free internet access anywhere in this hotel and they wanted €5 (I think) for 1 hours access and €20 for 24 hours. Everything seemed to be chargeable and even the bottle of water in our room has a €5 price tag! The gym, pool and sauna facilities were great, and was mainly empty when we chose to use it. A special thanks to Uwe at the Concierge desk who was very very helpful and gave us a whole host of information on what to do and the best way to get to the airport in time on the day we left with printouts and helpful advice! All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you don't intend on using the internet on your trip and want a central location. Ps. don't forget to check out the Arkaden shopping centre attached to the S-bahn station - quite an interesting stroll and doesnt close til 10pm on most nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vendair
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and so was the room. Disappointed with the standard of television in the room and the viewing choice . Only two English speaking films to choose from. No free internet and in this day and age i don't understand why a large hotel chain doesn't offer this service free considering the price of the room. The hotel swimming pool was cold .The hotel has its own restaurant specialising in steak. I ordered a medium to well done steak and got a rare steak.When I pointed this out I was given a free glass of coke as compensation. If this is the usual standard of service in the restaurant i can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night in November 2010 and had a great stay. The location is perfect, on Potzdamer Platz, and the service in the hotel was very good. The hotel in itself was in a very good shape, with the usual Marriott comfort. Welcoming staff that was able to help a few requests I had. The pool is a bit small but nice, they have a good sauna & great health club. Additionnaly the rate was good for a week end stay (140€). Definitily I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Phobie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a weekend break, the hotels locations is great, just steps away from the Sony centre, brandenburg Gates, Subway, to name but a few. The staff are very friendly and the food is great in the resturant "Midtown Grill". If i had to pick on downfall I would say that the english speaking channels are limited on the TV, you only get SKY News, CNN and BBC News which is very annoying after a while cause its the same news on all the time. There are about 30 channels on the TV so a few more english ones would be great!!

Reviews.Title: “Just in the center of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: pseisog
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, just 5 minutes walk from the zoo and aquarium...... Also very close to a metro station that connects you to the most important landmarks of Berlin...... Worth the visit to the 6th floor of KaDeWe (food market floor) just to have a look...... Great breakfast, very helpful stuff and you have to make a visit at the pool also !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff located in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dms200912
Reviews.Content: The Concierge was one of the best we have ever had at a hotel. They made us reservations for dinner, helped us figure out where the best night life was located and how far, and told us where to go for late night eats. The front desk was just as wonderful and friendly; they always had a smile and a greeting for us! You could not beat the location of the hotel, either. It is right on the Potsdammer Platz, so you have easy access to anywhere in the city because of the U-bahn right there. The Sony Center is right there if you just want a nice place to eat or watch a movie. Also, the Brandenburg Gate is only a five to ten minute walk from there. Taxis are always right next to the hotel as well, if you don't want to walk real far or take the train. The rooms were really big; in fact, they are American-sized rooms, rather than the European size. There was four of us and we fit comfortably in one room. The beds are nice and soft, and we slept very soundly, no matter what time of day it is! For the location and the size of the rooms, we only spent about 365 euros for three nights, including parking and a few things we charged to the room. All in all, it was a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and nice. The location was walking distance to the parliment, train, holocust memorial etc. The room was nice and clean . Would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EgyptMohamed
Reviews.Content: Bed and pillows were very comfortable as usual with Marriott, staff were trying to be helpful and nice, location was good but keep in mind it is not in potsdamer platz itself it is in a side street close to it was difficult to find, breakfast was very very basic like 3 stars hotel, the room was a bit cold as the heating was not very effecient I had to ask for a heater in my room. I only recommend this hotel if you can get a real bargain price for it.

Reviews.Title: “If you'd rather not go out to eat, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: Micheletex
Reviews.Content: I booked this stay to use some Marriott points up, and then upgraded to a wonderful corner room with a view of the Potsdam Platz snow slide and executive lounge privileges. There was so much food available in the lounge that I never went anywhere else to eat! Started with scrambled eggs, sausage, fruit and muesli for a late breakfast, then hiked all over town, returning for a beer and snacks in the later afternoon. Then they would bring out a couple of hot dishes at 5:30, along with a different soup, and several appetizers and desserts, as well as liquor and wine. The lounge also had WiFi and a separate, quiet room with three computers.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made me yawn”
Reviews.Author: RoxxyGirl
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be so very average and so very boring. Yes, it was clean and shiny but also painfully corporate feeling. Really, you could have been anywhere in the world. Location: My friends and I had been to Berlin 2 years prior to this visit and only booked this hotel because my friend used points. It was the last night of a 2 week trip and we just needed a place to sleep before our flight. The area is very touristy and not very “authentic” Berlin at all. It’s like staying in Times Square when you come to NYC. Sorry, I don’t want to see a Starbucks when I walk out of the hotel. However, some people like that about this location and that’s fine too. This is just my personal opinion. Last time we were in Berlin we booked the Adina Hotel (also using Marriott points) and I liked that so much better- more neighborhoody location and smaller boutique hotel with a w/d in the room. Rooms: Large, clean and Marriott. We had a city view looking out but as stated before, I could have been anywhere. We had access to the executive lounge and that was a plus- as there was food and drinks and computers to use (no free wireless in the room but it was avail here). There were several Americans we met in the lounge and that were in Berlin on extended business stays. This hotel would be ideal for business travel. Overall: there was nothing wrong with this hotel I just didn’t like it for a stay over one night. If the hotel is priced high (which seems to be based on the reviews) then don’t stay here as there are so many better options in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel needs to step up - However a Great City, Great Location, Great Breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: CheviotBoycie Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate, other sites very close and easy to find. The trip was for leisure to see the city and enjoy the Xmas Markets. It was cold and snowy so it was very seasonal and the friendly people of Berlin made it a 5 day trip to remember - we will go back as there is still so much to see. We did a walking tour and would really recommend it (www.insidertour.com) as it is good value for money. You may want to avoid the Cancun Bar opposite the Marriott Hotel on Potsdamer Plaz as it was an expensive place for what it is and the atmosphere lacked any personal touch and seemed to be just about money. The Marriott needs to step up to the plate; new revolving doors had just been fitted to the front, but no heater had been installed to reduce the cold air drifting in (it was about -14c at night) so the Bar/Lobby was cold and not very enjoyable. The rooms did not appear to be hovered on a daily basis and we did have to suffer from some building maintenance work and the annoying sound of a hammer drill. However the breakfast was the best I have had in this type of hotel. Although I would recommend the hotel, it is mainly because of it's location and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at an above-average price”
Reviews.Author: wbpld
Reviews.Content: I seem to be going against the majority here, but I found the Berlin Marriott to be a perfectly average, unremarkable hotel. It undeniably has a fabulous central location, close to numerous tourist attractions and public transportation, but it's location on a side street means that noise is minimal. I have no real complaints about the hotel, but I would have expected more of a "five star" experience based on the steep price I paid. The room was clean an comfortable, with all of the expected standard amenities. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but we stayed there for nine days and the only thing that changed was the flavor of the daily fruit smoothie--otherwise it became very predictable. Most of the time we came back to the room in the afternoon to find that it had not been made up and we had to contact the housekeeping staff to get it done. The front office staff was cordial and professional, but nobody went out of their way to be particularly friendly or helpful (with the exception of the concierge one evening when we were asking about local tourist sites). However, service at the restaurant was excellent. Again, I have nothing really negative to say about this hotel, and the location alone would make it worthwhile if you can get a bargain rate. However, don't expect a five-star experience. Warning: try to avoid rooms on the third floor (the lowest room floor): the windows are up quite high and it is difficult to look out (unlike the floor-to-ceiling windows shown in most photos)--not that it matters, since the only view is the roof of the lower part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Markets”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Berlin to visit the many Christmas Markets throught the city and stayed at the Berlin Marriott. It was a perfect location for exploration of any kind, located in Potsdammer Platz. The price was lower than others in this location. The first Market was one block from our hotel. When we arrived we were greeted by a Door Man and inside directed to the front desk for a speedy early check in @ 12:oo noon as I had requested. our room was on the sixth floor-perfect and was bright and fresh when we entered. The bath was large and well stocked with towels, hair dryer, and toiletries for out use. The Concierge was great help with finding our way around the city and the oldest Christmas Market in Berlin which we would have missed if not for his suggestion and a great suggestion it turned out to be. Check out was a breeze & we would definately stay here again. There was a German Coffee Shop on one corner and a Starbucks on the other corner outside our door. The only complaint we have is the price of breakfast in the hotel, it was waaaaay too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying noise and lack of personal service, but still the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: Krolikow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott in 20-24 October, the problem was that there are heavy construction works in a lobby (they are adding another entrance) which are starting exactly at 9:30 on business days which could very very annoying if they will put you on a lower floors. After my complains I was suggested for a free upgrade but I didn't find any sense cause it was Friday already and there are no works on weekends and I loved my room. So again be aware of possible annoying noise! Another my complain is their concierge service - it was the first time in my hotel's experience when I asked concierge for a nice restaurant and got a map, a round on it and was told to find it by myself in it! In Marriott - no more comments on it :( But everything else were almost perfect, I can't say that I am really disappointed, but will I stay in it again, I think I will not.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice/central hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrhweezie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. The rate I got through my compnay's travel website was very good. The location was perfect for me since it was close to the office. All staff that I encountered were very nice. Check-in was smooth and efficient. One note - the front of the hotel is undergoing construction so you do have to enter through the side. I am not sure how long the construction is going on but it didn't interfere with my stay at all. My room was very nice and had a good view. The room was spacious with a king bed. I also had a desk and internet access. My company has an agreement with Marriott for free internet so I don't know how much they nornally charge. The bathroom was very big, especially by European standards. There was plenty of hot water with good water pressure. The room also had a good sized safe. I had room service one night. Service was fast and the food was very good. I had one free day to tour the area and found everything easily accessible from the hotel. Potsdamer Platz was 1 block away and there were plenty of s-bahn and u-bahn lines that run through this station. Most of the major sites are easily walkable too. I didn't do much nightlife but Potsdamer Platz did have a lovely Christmas Market that was open all day and into the evening.
