Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great food, great city”
Reviews.Author: JasonMadden
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Hotel a couple weeks ago and they really treated me well. The room was had a good set up with comfortable spacing. I got some of the best sleep I've ever had in a hotel. The location was good to, sites and restaurants right around the corner. The staff was kind and the receptionist even gave me a few tips on what to see, Brandenburg Gate Sony Center, the great view from Panorama Punkt, they were all amazing. I'll be staying with Marriot if I can from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but antique televisions...best for location”
Reviews.Author: globalfun00
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the location can't be beat. Right next to Starbucks which is good because the internet is super-expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A hint of sweaty armpits”
Reviews.Author: joaozinho
Reviews.Content: A fairly standard chain hotel in a soulless part of town. Most things as you’d expect. Only points to make it stand out from any other chain hotel were a slightly tired look to the room, a lack of tea & coffee making facilities (normally taken for given at a Marriott) and a distinct smell of sweaty armpits in the room. We were staying in July and the room desperately needed airing. We left the window open for the afternoon and by the time we got back the stale odour was a lot less. Note to Mr Marriott – open the window now and then (although I admit the catches were really tricky to work and it took me 10 minutes to close it again).

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EJH20
Reviews.Content: great hotel- travelled with work for conference- good food, excellant dinner in steakhouse, good location for speed walking quick tour of berlin wall, brandenburg gate, couple of beer stops etc only had half a day to see around!! ok for me as i have been to berlin before!! not much around to do at night had to travel by taxi to get a good night out!!

Reviews.Title: “EXECUTIVE HOTEL AND VERY COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: ZanteCreteRhodes
Reviews.Content: Amazing place for a city break, hotel excellent with fantastic views and service, Rooms immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Eminently Germanic”
Reviews.Author: steve_r123
Reviews.Content: You are welcomed by a very striking lobby, and very efficient service from the reception staff. The spinning floating globe proved very popular with the younger members of our party. Our standard double room was large and bright, and very clean. Full length opening windows were also a great addition, and enabled you just stand and watch Berlin go by. The bed was very comfortable, complete black out curtains, and good noise levels all came together to provide a very good nights sleep. Breakfast was slightly disorganised by German standards, and the restaurant became very busy, very quickly. The hot food would often run out, and queues would form very quickly. Luckily the food is replenished quite quickly, and the queues disperse as quickly as they appear. The location is absolutely great for exploring Berlin, only being about a 10-15 minute walk from the Brandenburg Gate, and the underground train service is easy to navigate. The Sony Centre is just around the corner, and is a nice place to go for a drink. There is a Chinese restaurant located in the building next door to the Marriott, which I can highly recommend for a good value meal. All in all, the Marriott was a very nice hotel so long as you aren't expecting anything too 'fancy'.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Marriot, a gem not to be missed!!”
Reviews.Author: CyprusElena
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a seven nights stay at Berlin Marriot and words cannot describe enough our experience and feelings. The hotel is superb right in the middle of everything in an elegant area called Postamer Platz, with an underground tube opposite the hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and the hotel is all itself a gem. The front desk staff is helpful and very friendly. We had a deluxe room for a great deal without breakfast from the web site bookandback.com. Next to the hotel, you can find Starbucks, a lovely Asian restaurant called Coa and a nice cafe that you can have breakfast called Caras gourmet. Also just opposite, you can find Sony Centre, which is amazing and Arcade, which is full of shops and restaurants. If you are travelling with children, dont miss Legoland, the Zoo and the Aquadom and the Technological Museum.. All in one, Berlin is an excellent city with so much to explore and were sad to leave after 7 nights. We will sure be back and there will be no doubt that we are staying at Berlin Marriot once more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring”
Reviews.Author: MROYAL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2010. Excellent service, very clean, comfortable hotel. Excellent staff throughout especially the desk and concierge staff. Location is excellent for touring, next to Podstamer Platz and the Metro system. We used this a lot especially the U2 service to Alexander Platz. between these two areas you can pretty much cover the main sites in Berlin. Highly recomended to stay here, but the berr is 6 euros a go and the midtown grill is nice but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Greate Location! Greate Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsiv
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel inspite of the fire-alarm testing at 10 PM and inspite that the Restaurant was closed for the renovation on the second day of our stay. The breakfast is full, I didn't need the lunh after such breakfast )). The service is not so bad as others wrote here. The consierge is not really open but he helped us with the cultural programm. The location is super, the underground is close the main popular attractions are in a walking distance. Sony centre, Christmas market, Bundestag and so on... Overall I liked it and will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Lacks Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Judgys
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a great location. Right on the central train and underground lines for access across the city. 5 minute walk to the Bradenburg Gate, Jewish Memorial, Tiergarten and Sony Centre. This city is so walkable from this location. Given late check out of 2pm as soon as we checked in and at weekends you get breakfast served until 3pm in the afternoon. This is needed due to the sloppy and rude service you receive at breakfast despite speaking German. The breakfast has a great choice but being buffet style the staff enjoy leaving you with your selection of plates and dishes and never clearing them off your tiny table. They also don't bother asking about tea and coffee, that is your job to ask their gracious selves to assist you with this. This for us was the only drawback of this hotel, we stayed in room 571 which was quite and nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable and feather pillows. The hotel were flexible in providing soya but did have a call from the UK to confirm, requested at booking and sent hotel an e-mail direct and still not provided until I asked where it was, they then bought some to my room and also ensured it was available at breakfast. I would stay here again for the comfort and location. Other colleagues used the spa facilities and pool and confirmed they were great. Only down point is that a lot of hotels in Germany do not have tea/coffee facilities in their rooms, the bar staff, who were excellent, will provide you with a jug of hot water of you have your own milk etc.

Reviews.Title: “a nice alternative”
Reviews.Author: michaeltran1990
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at Hotel de Rome or The RC but they were fully booked. It's a decent alternative, good property with some good staff. Housekeeping does a good job and the breakfast if supperb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with great service”
Reviews.Author: StevensbikeErkrath
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this hotel and it always has been great. Though in the center of Berlin and in walking distance to many attractions (Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Jüdisches Mahnmal, Sony Center) the rooms are absolutely quiet. The breakfast, though not realy cheap, is excellent and covers for the most part of the day. The service is great from check in to the service at the restaurant. If you get access to the lounge, try it. Great view over Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel except for internet”
Reviews.Author: dkemt
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel-no complaints except the for the internet access (wired), which was painfully slow. The hotel had the audacity to charge 20 Euros per 24 hours for it too! Lobby and room were nice, location great, pool and gym small but functional. The management should consider either providing free internet access or upgrading their system if they insist on charging this much.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel076
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance from the Brandenburg Gate, the Memorial to the Murdered Jews, the JFK Museum, a display of portions of the Berlin Wall, Potsdamer Platz metro and it either sits on, and depending on the room, stradles where the Berlin Wall once stood. The hotel has a great staff willing to answer any question. The rooms are large and comfortable. The Midtown Grill restaurant offers a great food at decent prices. There is plenty to do in Berlin and the Marriiott Hotel Berlin is a great home base to do it all.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring hotel at an uninspring location in an uninspiring city”
Reviews.Author: Yerevan75
Reviews.Content: the rooms at the Marriot Berlin are small and nothing to write home about. Location is near a metro station that has an undergound shopping floor but the area is a kind of no man's land that was rebuilt after the unification of Berlin and is totally void of character. The executive lounge serves a good dinner buffet and service is great throughout the hotel. Breakfast is appaling as is usually the case in Marriot hotels. Gym and indoor swimming pool are excellent but even they couldn't inspire me to write a more interesting review of this boring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: foulaman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Marriott. There were positives but several frustrating negatives as well. On arrival after an overnight flight from the Middle East our room was not available, but within a couple of hours the front desk called our mobile to advise we could check in a couple of hours before the 3:00 pm check-in time. We were advised that if we wanted internet service we could either pay Euro 20 per day, or for Euro 25 per day we could upgrade to an Executive room with internet included and amenities such as a city view and tea/coffee service in-room. We opted for the Executive room, and were given a room on the 10th (top) floor. However when we arrived in the room there was no tea/coffee set and the view was limited. We returned to the front desk and asked for a different room, but were given one on the 9th floor with no view (looking into the non-street side of the building), and again no tea/coffee set. By that time we could not be bothered making another trip to the front desk to change rooms again. We called and they said they would send up a kettle, which arrived quickly, but without any means of making tea or coffee. Another call to the front eventually resulted in a tea/coffee set, but half way through our stay the cups and spoons were removed and never returned, and the tea and coffee were never replenished. The room was pleasant enough and clean, but there were only 2 bath towels provided. The closet was among the smallest we have ever seen, and difficult to use with a lot of clothes for business meetings. The bed linens were to have been changed every 3 days but they were not changed during the 5 nights we stayed in the hotel. The breakfast room was pleasant and there was a good selection. The breakfast wait staff were very good, pleasant and efficient, even under hectic conditions. One other small annoyance was that our room key (which was also needed for the lift) was cancelled three days in a row, entailing stops at the front desk to have the cards re-activated. Overall, there were so many small frustrations that we would not choose to stay there the next time in Berlin. There are several other options in the same general area near Potsdamer and Liepziger Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nana_JP
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is right in the middle of everything, easy access to the main tourist sites, great staff, good food, good room service, comfortable bed, large and clean room. There is just nothing but good to say.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, superb service, superb experience”
Reviews.Author: Brionnais
Reviews.Content: I spent several days at a conference here earlier this month. I found every aspect of the experience enjoyable - the large, gracious room with over-sized bath, the very comfortable bed, the delicious breakfasts, the well-run multi-day event, the friendly and professional staff. A delightful 3 days!

Reviews.Title: “Average to Good, Not Great. Faux Five Star.”
Reviews.Author: Surely_U_Jest
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel so I will admit I had high expectations as my original four day visit in October 2008 was exceptional. Oh what a difference a year makes. If I had to capture the property's essence, I would have to say that they were in a word: indifferent. First I am Marriott Gold. Meaning I spend a lot of my nights in a Marriott just to give you some context. I booked this hotel using points and my status "earns" me access to the "Executive Lounge." We arrived in at the hotel by taxi from the airport in the pouring rain. Nobody came out to help us with our luggage. There was a security guard who watched us but offered no assistance. He simply pointed toward the lobby. We wheeled our bags inside ourselves all the way to the front desk without being intercepted by or encountering a bellman. Now normally I don't care all that much, but in this case I was in the final stages of recovering from a broken leg and depended on a cane, so a little help would have been welcomed. I let my displeasure be known and they explained that the security guard is a contract employee who cannot help with the bags and desk clerk had no idea where the bellman was. Unlike their sister property the Ritz-Carlton, the Marriott does not have someone stationed outside to assure a positive guest experience upon arrival. Five stars, huh? It was about 3:15 PM and our room was not ready even though it was past the check-in time. They provided us interim access to the lounge. They did not inquire about our bags, we had to ask to check them. A bellman finally came and heaved them on to a baggage cart, one on top of the other. My partner actually went over and re-positioned the bags in a manner more respectful of our property. Not sure if this was indifference or disdain. We got up to the lounge on the tenth floor and the keys didn't work, so back down we went. The lounge was a welcome respite, quiet, well stocked with free wireless internet. However, more about this later. The room became available about an hour later. They brought the keys up to the lounge and took our bags to the room without us asking. Clearly this was more akin to the service level I remembered. The rooms are spacious with comfortable bedding. You aren't going to say "WOW", but they are tastefully decorated and appointed. It is the standard American style Marriott room down to the garish gem tones. From my experience it is a 3.5 - 4.0 standard. Our king room had two terry-cloth bathrobes and two bath towels as part of the standard set-up. We had to ask each day for extra towels, rather than them noting the request for the entirety of our stay. There are no balconies, but the center floor to ceiling window opens like a door. The views of Berlin are quiet nice. Oh yeah, their was a barking dog in the room next door. Luckily he only barked when his owners weren't there. We asked the front desk to let them know, and they looked mortified by the request. Not sure if they ever did, since we didn't really get an "of course." Now, about the "Executive Lounge". Let me just be clear. I don't have a problem with children. Well, that is not entirely true. My views about children and travel are simple. I have raised mine: I don't care to raise or interact with yours especially when I am on vacation. To be honest the kids were behaving as children do. The real problem was inconsiderate parents who don't understand that bringing their children into a hotel EXECUTIVE Lounge is a privilege. For all you parents out there, here is a clue. If your on a family vacation but don't want to sit at the same table as your kids, ask yourself why? It was only my partners pleading eyes that kept me from telling the mother jumping out from behind the curtain yelling boo at her three year old, that this was not a playground. The lounge staff takes NO steps to try and assure that the overall guest experience is not denigrated even after being prompted. Five stars? Not hardly. Also, do not depend on the front desk staff or the concierge for advice about activities or restaurants. They are all relatively young and new to the hotel. Your best bets are the internet and sites like trip advisor. My tips. The Fat Tire Bike Tour is a must do. The Pergamon is not closed on Mondays contrary to what you might be told. If you are looking for a "german" dining experience for not a lot of money with good food, great house wine and outdoor dining then head over to the Hackescher Hof.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty great hotel, in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: IJG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Berlin for two nights in April. We found the staff to be very helpful and very informative. Our room was huge! With a pretty good view. There was plenty of room to move around and felt very spacious. The linens were crisp and clean and changed daily. The hotel wireless internet is not free of charge (unless you are on the executive levels), however, if you go to the bar and order something from the snack menu, you are entitled to use the internet for one hour for free. This was really handy for us as we could up load our photo's and research the next leg of the trip without having to pay extra for internet use. The hotel also has a large gym room and pool, which also has a water and mineral water cooler (handy for filling up the water bottles, instead of having to buy new ones for the next day!) The hotel is about a 5 minute drive from Berlin Hauptbahnhof. That is the station closest to the hotel, make sure you don't get off at Ostbahnhof station, which is the end of the line for the Eurorail trains. The hotel is fairly central for most of the sightseeing attractions, you will have to walk about 10 minutes or more, to get to most of them but as Berlin is fairly spread out this would happen no matter which hotel you stayed at. Make sure you take advantage of the free walking tours, which leave from outside the Starbucks coffee shop near the Brandenburg Gates at 11am and 1 pm. We really enjoyed this tour and got a lot out of it. Overall we enjoyed our time at this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, uncomfortable service.”
Reviews.Author: Zunks
Reviews.Content: For my husband and my recent trip to Berlin, we booked the Berlin Marriott using reward points, so the 4 nights we stayed were free of charge. I went back and forth between this Marriott and the Courtyard Marriott, but ultimately am happy with the decision. Check in: The hotel has an impressive lobby, so first impressions are positive. Unfortunately for us, even though I requested early arrival (and was told this request was entered), they did not have our room ready for us. We had been up for 36 hours at this point, so while they offered to watch our bags so we could explore the city, we weren't in the mindset or condition to do so. We opted to wait, and they told us they would get a room ready as soon as they could. Two hours later, and watching no less than 20 individuals after us check in and get a room, (we had been sitting in the lobby during this time), I approached the desk and asked if they knew how much longer it would be. They told me that it could be another 3 hours before a room was ready, they simply did not know an exact time. This was extremely frustrating considering they are a 5 star hotel and I was assured before leaving that we had early arrival! We waited an additional 35 minutes and they came over with our room key. *Note: besides the individual who gave us our room key saying, "I apologize for your wait," nothing else was done for us. Room: The room was nice for European standards and space. The bed was exceptionally comfortable - great comforter, pillows, and mattress! My husband and I slept well every night, this was arguably the best part of the hotel. There was a nice table and chairs with another side chair to lounge in, and the bathroom met our expectations. The mini bar was expensive; stop in a small grocery store and you will get the same items for half price! There are robes and slippers to wear which was a nice touch, as well as a safe. It would have been great to have a coffee pot in the room, but thankfully there is a Starbucks right around the corner from the hotel. The temperature in the room was comfortable and it was very quiet. Pool/sauna - we did not use these but did stop in to look at them. Very tranquil and romantic - if this was for business it would have been a nice break in the day, or if we had more time in the city it would have been something on our list to do! Location - This was very close to Potsdamer Platz metro station, and in walking distance of the Jewish Memorial, Brandenberg Gate, Reichstag, Unter den Linden, Sony Center, and Tiergarten. There is not much night life right outside the hotel area, but with the convenient transportation through the city this is a non-issue... the S bahn line where Potsdamer Platz is on is connected to a lot of night time "hot spots!" All in all, the location is excellent and a great central spot to navigate the city! Despite a rocky start to our stay, we did enjoy our time at Marriott Berlin. I gave it four stars for the beds, location, and overall comfort/cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights ate Marriott Berlin. The hotel is very well located within walking distace from many points of interest, e.g. Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc. Also S- and U-Bahn stations are just outside the hotel. It's not the most personal hotel in the World, but everything works. Rooms are nice and clean with floor to ceiling windows and lots of storage space (& safe, hair dryer, ironing facilities etc). Unfortunately internet connection is not included to the room price. Sound proofing seems to be excellent; we stayed in a room near elevator and were afraid that would be a problem, but there were absolutely no disturbances. Our room rate didn't include breakfast, but there are 3-4 cafes nearby. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel and good lcoation”
Reviews.Author: Olideacon
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline so we got a great price for the hotel. The hotel was really nice, and felt 5 stars throughout except for the bedroom. Although the bed itself and bathroom were amazing, the rest of the room felt very much like a standard motel room. There was nothing to suggest it was anything better than a good 4 star. This was my one and only issue, everything else was spot on. The service was excellent, the concierge and very helpful ladies on reception were brilliant for local information, restaurant recommendations and hotspot knowledge. It was a great place to base our first few nights in Berlin as it was right on top of a metro station, and very close to the Brandenburg gate and Reitstag. Recommended, particurlarly if you get a great priceline price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best sleeps I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: AliYilmaz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a very good location to start with; quiet neighborhood, very close to U-Bahn and S-Bahn. The check-in and check-out experience were smooth and quick, the service was very good. The room was clean and spacious with a big LCD and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. Late night room service had a too few options, but hey, that is something I can live with.

Reviews.Title: “Modern upmarket business hotel with no soul but in good position”
Reviews.Author: Limehouse_Lil
Reviews.Content: All is modern and clean and comfortable and the staff are suitably pleasant and cosmopolitan, but the high atrium seems to give the hotel the hushed feel of a library.and the bar, while comfortable, lacks atmosphere. The 'Midtown Grill' restaurant is pleasant enough international-style cuisine, but quite pricey and with sometimes erratic service. The rooms are so modern that they have an overly 'sterile' feel but they are well-equipped and the beds large and comfortable. The modern trend of dim lighting is frustrating. The central position of this hotel is excellent for business and sightseeing , right on the East/West border - indeed there is a piece of preserved Wall still standing nearby. List price is expensive but there are very reasonable deals to be had.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience at the Berlin, Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Cuba0
Reviews.Content: On October 8th, 2009, my collegue Dr. Patria Ovalles and I arrived at the Berlin Marriott. Right after checking in, we decided to book a private tour for that afternoon. I want to point out that the main purpose for the visit was to attend the European Dermatology Meeting that was being held in Berlin, however,u pon our arrival, we decided to take a tour of the city. The bellman taking care of us offered to book said tour, and once it was confirmed, we headed to our room to refresh and be ready. When we entered the elevator, a gentleman dressed as an employee, with a clipboard and pen in hand greeted us. We exited the elevator on the 8th floor and so did he. Since we were not familiar with the hotel, we hesitated as what direction to take; the gentleman asked our room number and clearly pointed out its location. Once in the room, and immediately after our luggage was delivered (by the same bellman), we heard a knock on our door. I was in the bathroom changing and my colleague looked thru the dooor chain. It was the same man we had met in the elevator requesting to enter our room to check the aircondition system. My colleague opened the door, the man checked the thermostat, and asked to please use our phone to report downstairs. Once he left the room, I exit the bathroom, and went straight to the desk where I had left my diamond ring, and gold bangles in order to wash my face. I should point out that all our valuables had been placed in the security box, and the only valuables outside were the ones we were using. Immediately after said individual left, the same bellman knocked on our door with a tour receipt to be signed, something that I found extremely rare, since those receipts are normally signed at the registration or consierge desk. After a couple of minutes we realized that the so called Marriott employee that was checking our aircondition had taken my ring. I immediately called downstairs and requested security to come up to the room. It took a good 20 to 25 minutes and several calls, as well as a desperate plea to a room service waiter , for security to come up, and among other things the person in charge, Marco, did not speak english, and had to bring a lady that worked in the restaurant or kitchen to serve as a translator.(this is happening in an American Hotel Chain) I was assured that everything was going to be resolved. I volunteered to check the video recorder in order to identify the man, since I still remembered him clearly and probably will never forget his face and/or hair style. At that time, and while security was in the room, my colleague realized that he had taken her wrist watch and a pouch where I had 360 Euros. Immediately after security left, the bellman knocked on our door again, to let us know that our tour driver was waiting downstairs, Again, why didn't he call?? Later in the evening when we returned from the tour, I requested to call the police and have a formal report since my ring along was worth over $14,000.00. I was told that it was going to take a while, to what I responded that I had the entire night to wait, and was going to remain in the hotel lobby until the police arrival. The police did arrive that night and requested our passports and a picture of my ring since the watch was a Michelle round watch that was easy to recognize. Luckily, I had my ring appraised and not only had a picture of it, but also the actual appraisal. I called my office in Miami, and within an hour they had the information requested. In addition, I requested a meeting with the hotel general manager since so far I had only talked to the hotel staff. A meeting was set for the next day early in the morning. At that time I was informed that the general manager was running late, and that he was going to meet with me later in the day. That same night I met with the general manager who was very apologetic, but informed me that their insurance would not cover because the ring was not in the safe. Well, the ring was not in the safe, because I was wearing it, and took it off just to wash my face! I requested a formal hotel report, and I did receive it about 2 weeks later. During my meeting with the hotel general manager I found out that the hotel did not have any video cameras in the elevators or hallways, and the only cameras were located in the hotel lobby. Also, the lobby had no security personnel, "to not scare hotel guests away". The only security body, was "outside the hotel" "to protect the hotel from a terrorist attack due to the fact that it is part of an american chain". I must admit that the hotel personnel was not only apologetic but very compassionate; however 4 month later (Feb 2010) they still claim that they have not reached a decision on whether they will cover our lost, or not. I feel that althought the lost was significant, the fact that there was "No security" in the hotel,and "no video cameras in the hallways or elevator" was a lot more important. I am a Marriott Gold Member. and have been staying at Marriotts for the past 15 to 18 years. Being a female that travels extensively, I look for security and protection in the hotels that I stay, especially if they are outside the US. Needless to say that is one of the main reasons that I choose the Marriott Hotels over and over. However, I am still in shock to know the poor security in the Berlin Marriott, something that I had never experienced in any of the Marriotts that I have stayed, whether in the US or abroad. I highly discourage any female to stay at that hotel, unless they restructure their management with an emphasis in guest's secutiry. Needless to say, this experience left us scared and dissapointed for the rest of our European vacation, that by the way, was booked in its entirety at Marriotts or Reinassence hotels in Hamburg as well as Copenhagen.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great situation, but pricy”
Reviews.Author: PierreC1
Reviews.Content: Of course this is what you have to expect from a Marriott in Potsdamer Platz right around everything. The bar and restaurant were expensive so i ate elsewhere. The room was spotless, the people and services around were perfect. If you want to visit Berlin this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal avarage business hotel”
Reviews.Author: madamtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the executive floor during a business trip of my husband. The room was comfortable , clean but fairly small. The executive lounge was dissappointing since snacks and proper food was not constantly on offer as you would find in top 5 star business hotels.Made you think why you would pay the extra rate for the executive floor. Breakfast buffet is extensive but again lacking of refinement. The staff is running around stressed out since it gets very buisy around 8.30-9.00 am.Didn't enjoy any bite there. Price-value ratio is definetly unfavourable .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jimilia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at the Marriot and we had a great time. The hotel is very plush, no doubt about it being 5*, it was immaculate, no a trace of dirt anywhere. We had a standard guest room (537) and it was roomy and very well decorated with a superkingsize bed. We overlooked the front of the hotel which was on a side street so it was nice and quiet. Large wardrobe with 12 hangers. Inroom safe. Bathroom had over-bath shower attachment, hairdryer, decent size towels, soap, shampoo, bath gel and body lotion. Mini bar had wine, water and some chocolate but we didn't use this (5euro for a 1 litre bottle of water). TV had usual selection of stations for world news, music and local tv shows. Location: 1 minute walk from Potsdamer Platz station, 2 minutes to Sony Centre, 5 minutes to Arkaden (over 100 shops and restaurants here, restaurants were very reasonable: 17euro for 2 main meals and 2 pints of lager). Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, offering us directions to Sachenhausen camp, they spoke very good English and did not laugh at our poor German :) We did not have breakfast here so cannot comment on that. In the lounge area they had an offer that if you bought something from the snack menu you could get free wifi access for an hour. We left our bags on the last day in the hotel as we had an evening flight and spent the day doing touristy things, when we collected our bags they were quite happy for us to sit in the lounge area, without us feeling pressured into buying something from the bar. Overall very, very pleased with this hotel. We booked it through Priceline (price line) and paid £65 total per night, absolute bargain! If I was to visit Berlin again, I would definitely stay here. Tip: for a quick bite to eat, go down to Potsdamer station and grab a sandwich from the German stall that is located near the Subway sandwich shop, they were very tasty and cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Marriott with a good location”
Reviews.Author: littev0ices
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the celebrations for the Berlin wall coming down using my Marriott points, I'm a Platinum member (75+ nights/year at Marriotts) so my treatment may not be representative of all travellers. Its been a few months since staying here... so a few 'thoughts' that stick out in my mind; Our room view was a reasonable side-view of the street where dominos were lined up to be toppled - nothing special but you are in the middle of Berlin! Location-wise was much better, being right next to Potsdam Platz (easy Public transport) and within easy walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag. The room was small for a Marriott, and with an old TV rather than a flatscreen which rather stood out. I think that the hotel is probably due for a refurb in a year or two as it was starting to look a little old. Still, the TV had the standard selection of TV channels for a large chain hotel, with a variety of different languages (French, Italian, Russian, English as well as German). Bathroom was also adequate. However, no upgrade for us on this visit though (but I appreciate I was paying with points when paying rooms were going for a significant amount of money). As usual a very comfy bed, shame there wasn't a huge amount of room around it (compared to most Marriotts) Executive lounge was nice, but packed with this being a special occasion, mostly with American guests as you'd expect in an American chain in Germany - free alcohol was a nice touch, reasonable breakfast too. Overall: Great location, room was disappointing but with a reasonable lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Just the once off!!!”
Reviews.Author: flinkaroo
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty ridiculous visit seein as only got the rooms by winning a prize so stuff like price didn matter! All the same it was a beautiful hotel with friendly and very helpful front staff. Didn have food as it was a bit out of the price range but they recommended a nice place just around the corner that was bothe trendy and nice! A great loction with part of the wasll just outside the hotel and a massive shopping center nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Craigy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first two nights of my stay. Hotel is a glorified Best Western not what they claim to be and mainly because of the staff at check in and concierge. Check in was very disppointing, the girl who checked us in had no interest in what she was doing and barely spoke a word. Concierge, we encountered two, a younger man who was very helpful and an older gentleman who like the girl at check in, had no interest in helping you. Doormen always hid behind the door when they saw you coming. Rooms were large, but cheaply decorated, batroom was tiny. Breakfast was excellent ans so were the wait staff, bar was also good. The rates they charge are too excessive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “It's 2010....Let's have a great and wonderful new year!”
Reviews.Author: ceedaworld
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is what it is. Does this hotel surpass others that I have been to? Let me lead you on my journey. New years hotel guests can be a test for the staff at any hotel. I think the staff did what they could, but 180 check outs an 60 check ins (on my day) would foil any hotel's planners. Pro of the hotel: Clean rooms, beautiful location, lots to see and do within a safe walking distance, fitness center open 24 hours a day, Marriott scent in the lobby. Cons; No express check in or check out. Only for executive floors. very busy midtown grill with young bouncy inefficient staff members. The japanese breakfast was very "off." Stick to the solid points of german food. I watched as the foreign tourists basically ordered local food fair. I mean you are in Germany, lets eat like we are here. The rooms could be any Marriott in the world. The food was nice and to order. I had a filet mignon and it was perfect. topped off with a nice dessert. Midtown grill is very adequate. Any insights? They have a free internet airline check in ticket service in the business center., The concierge was always helpful. Taxis around the corner. Historical rooms sit on an east west property lines in the hotel. All in all I would recommend this place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “New year in berlin.”
Reviews.Author: renax8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and very close to all main attractions. The rooms are spacious and very- very clean. But what we liked best was the bed which was excellent. I think is the best bed that I have ever slept. It's huge and you feel like if you are sleeping in a cloud of feathers. So are the pillows!!! The staff is very helpful and polite. May all staff in all hotels be like this. They upgrated us to the executive floor were you have access to the executive lounge were they serve almost all day and all night free delicious snacks and free drinks. This was a very nice touch. To conclude a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located standard 4* Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Sal123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a holiday in December. We found the reception staff very helpful and friendly - drawing on a map where to find the best Christmas markets and sorting out late check out for us with no fuss. The location is excellent - both for walking to central tourist attractions and for transport links on the S & U bahns. This hotel is just like every other Marriott I have stayed in and by being rated at 5* it sets itself up to disappoint. I would echo the previous reviewer comments on the lack of space in the mini-bar to refridgerate anything you bought. We didn't try the breakfast as no breakfast should cost 32 Euros. Be aware that the directions in the hotel information folder to Schonefeld airport by public transport tell you to get on the U-bahn in the wrong direction - this resulted in us having to call a taxi to ensure we got to the airport on time which is more expensive that the train ticket we already had. We booked through Priceline "name your own price" which made the hotel much more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: fcfrag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were disappointed with this hotel. It would be an adequate 3 or 3.5 star hotel, but it most certainly is not a 4 or 4+ star hotel. The good news - our room was spacious for a European hotel room. The bad news, everything else. For starters, there was no doorman, or were the employees we saw continually hiding behind the Trabi at the left of the door smoking cigarettes the doormen? There appeared to be no bellmen either. At least we were offered no help with our luggage. I stopped by the concierge desk five times during our stay. I had just simple questions, but only once was I actually able to speak to anyone. Twice the concierge was on the phone and he ignored me. Once the desk was unmanned (during midmorning). Once there was a line for the single concierge so I did not wait. Once I actually talked to someone and he had little to offer me other than a cheap tourist map. I cannot imagine what the response would have been to a real request for information, recommendations, or reservations. I do not think it would have been acceptable. The health club was simply closed. It appeared that no alternatives had been arranged. While some may not care, this is part of the reason some people pay for 4 star hotels. Considering the room, it was at best... Spartan. As I said above, it was large, but the furnishings were minimal. The TV was an ancient CRT model. Hotels in this price range should provide newer flat panel models. The minibar was one of those very tacky and unsophisticated models where you cannot use the refrigerator to chill anything else. Indeed, if one touches anything in it they are immediately charged. This is very low class. In the bathroom there were exactly two hand towels and two bath towels, both of, at best, intermediate quality. There were no robes and no slippers. Most importantly, the bed mattress was completely worn out. I've slept on better quality mattresses in 2 star hotels. Clearly, the room displayed a philosophy of providing the absolute minimum required. As to service, my reservation profile calls for extra foam pillows. this was the first Marriott ever that failed to provide them. It's not a big issue but it does display a lack of service. Also, I cannot remember the last time a Marriott hotel did not offer a daily newspaper. Finally, at checkout an attempt was made to charge me for the awful breakfasts served in the Midtown Grill. I had to prove, by showing my reservation printout, that they were included in the price. Incidentally, the same attempt was made of the person next to me at checkout. Further regarding the breakfasts, while the cold German buffet was adequate, nothing special but adequate, the hot food buffet should be shut down for health safety reasons. In the U.S. it most certainly would be. Hot food absolutely cannot be left unheated (to 140 degrees F) on a buffet line lest it become a breeding ground for bacteria. Yet the sausages, bacon, eggs and pancakes were all at room temperature all four days that we were there. It appeared that there was a conscious attempt at shaving every expense and quite frankly, I've stayed at plusher Courtyard Marriotts. I sent a letter similar to this to two different "guest relations managers". Neither bothered to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel in a Convenient Location to Sites and Transportation”
Reviews.Author: Kathytravels
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriotts a lot on business travel-this Marriott is a step above the ones in the US. I stayed on the 9th floor and had access to the executive lounge. The selection of food and beverages was outstanding. They had hot and cold items for breakfast and cocktail hour, and a nice selection of beer, wine, and alcohol. There was fresh fruit available all day. There may be an option to upgrade to the executive floors for an extra stipend. It was nice to com back after a long day of sightseeing and not have to think about going out to dinner. My room was large and comfortable and the linens were good quality. I also had a fabulous view of the Gendarmarkt and TV Tower. The bathroom was on the small side, but impeccably clean. My only complaint was that the body lotion, shampoo and conditional, which was labeled 'Herbal' and probably of decent quality, smelled to me like Murphy's Oil Soap. Yuck. I tried the Midtown Grill, which was excellent. I had a sirloin and a fabulous Valrhona brownie for dessert. The Potsdamer Platz area is more of a business destination and the selection of restaurants is limited. I received an email a few days ago from the Guest Relations Manager thanking me for my stay. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, not much else to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: orlyk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for the recent 20th anniversary of the wall coming down and the Marriott was the ideal spot for the festivities as I could walk everywhere. The room was fine, but I was disappointed in a few things: 1/the towels were TINY - I am a petite woman of 5ft2 and could just about get a towel around my waist but a normal sized man would have needed about 4 of them sewn together in order to get dry 2/toiletries were very basis, no conditioner, no cotton wool The spa and swimming pool were both closed for refurbishment, which was disappointing The toilets in the reception area were also being refurbished and closed. When sitting in the lobby with friends, we had to climb a flight of stairs and fight our way through a couple of function rooms (not easy for my 8 month pregnant friend) in order to get to a toilet. Not impressive in a hotel of this standard. The breakfast buffet looked impressive but for E32/head I found the quality of the food very poor, especially the scrambled eggs, which were salty and congealed. The staff couldnt cope with the number of guests and there was a long wait for coffee/hot drinks. In a place like Berlin, where there are so many good hotels, I think the Marriott needs to step up its standards.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel In A Great City”
Reviews.Author: Fravellist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights for an International Conference and was very pleased with my overall stay. Check-in was very smooth and I received my room preferences without problem. Room and fittings were good and the bathroom was spacious. My only criticism of the room is the 'old style' TV, which are slowly becoming more scarce in hotels of a similar quality. The Executive Lounge is perhaps the best Marriott lounge I've visited. The food choice is good, there's beer on tap, and the area is large enough to cater for more than the average lounge. The hotel location, right by Potsdamer Platz is very handy for the U-Bahn and S-Bahn services, and for shopping areas too. I plan to return for a leisure break sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort, cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: MortUSA_Polska
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Berlin Marriott and highly recommend it to anyone considering a trip to Berlin. All the staff were very gracious. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were decadent! Only downside was that the bathroom was somewhat basic for such a new hotel, but this is being picky. The room was quiet...except for the room doors, which is in every hotel, noisy. I think somebody could make a fortune if they could invent quiet doors for hotel rooms. That said, this is an ideal hotel, only about a 5 minute walk to the Brandenburg gate. I loved the history of Berlin but it is not a "charming" city.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good but slightly inconsistent experience”
Reviews.Author: AllisonLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights from 26th Oct. My husband, daughter 4 and I shared a standard room. With two double beds it was plenty big enough for the three of us and very comfortable. A last I've found a bed that actually compares favourably to mine at home. The breakfast was great. There was plenty of variety with about 5 different stations. We ate in the restaurant twice in the evening and thought the food was pretty good, lovely steak. Massive portions. Toasting marshmallows at our table was a big hit for our little one. I found the restaurant service a bit hit and miss in the morning, but it was better in the evening. We had a bit of situation with a dining package we had purchased, the hotel had no knowledge of it. It took some time to get it sorted much to my irritation, but it did get sorted and the hotel went out of their way to redeem themselves. It was my husband's birthday while we were there and we ended up with cakes and lots of other nice little touches eg setting a "special" table for our breakfast. They really did make an effort. My daughter was unwell while we were there and to be honest I didn't find the evening front of house staff particularly helpful or sympathetic in terms of helping me find medication. I ended up going off in a taxi to a pharmacy at midnight. However, the following day the concierge couldn't do enough and let us keep our room until we departed at 1600. So a bit of a mixed bag. However, I am super picky and would stay there again. The location is fabulous for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Marriott in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Southpawfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott for 6 nights. Nicole, the guest relations manager, offered us an upgrade to a corner suite and executive level access for 120 Euros/night and I have to say that that was a great deal. The two room suite was spacious with floor to ceiling windows which I always love in a hotel. The door was heavy and thick like a vault door. Never heard a sound from outside our suite. Even the knock from room service was heard to hear. I wish some American hotels would build to this quality. A previous reviewer criticized the bell staff and concierge. We had zero problems with them but also recognized that the culture in Berlin is different than other parts of the world. They may not seem as eager to initiate an encounter, but they were always there and willing to help when asked. The Midtown Grill, which is the hotel restaurant, had great steaks with very professional wait staff. Sache and Sophie were great! The lounge/bar was lively with a lengthy list of specialty cocktails. The bar even has an Internet Radio Station with live DJ behind a soundproof glass window. We found the bar and restaurant staff very personable and friendly. The executive lounge had the most complete food and beverage service of any hotel we have been to so far. If you had to, one could easily find enough to eat for breakfast and dinner. You can make your own cocktails, or have wine/beer. Wireless internet is available for free in this top floor lounge or you can use one of the three workstations. Others have commented on the great location of this hotel. It is in Potsdamer Platz adjacent to the huge Sony Center. You are also a short walk away from Brandenburg Tor and the Reichstag. We chose to rent a car one day to go driving and found a very helpful Hertz location about 5 blocks away. I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “I would never go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: VPR011
Reviews.Content: I actually could not believe what poor service we received from this hotel and kept checking with others to reassure myself I was not being a spoiled b... First of all, there was no bellboy to take my suitcases when I arrived (or hold the door), not did the doorman ever even try to open the door for me (or call a cab) for the 6 days I stayed there. I took a taxi at least once daily and always had to hail it myself. The middle-aged, salt and pepper haired, bespectacled concierge is the rudest, meanest and most unpleasant person in the hotel. Very unhelpful, demeaning to the guests, and talks with an air of "you are not good enough for me" that I was especially ticked off by! We had to ask for: hangers, hair conditioner, slippers, a coffee pot (never got the coffee, though)...unbelievable. We got one small bar of soap and one small shampoo that we used for the entire stay (never got an extra one for just in case we run out). For that price ($1500 for 5 nights)! One good thing: the breakfast. However, it is the same every day, so even that joy wore off by day three.

Reviews.Title: “You know what to expect when staying at a Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JW1955
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Marriott, Berlin in October. We arrived by train as the hotel is next door to Potsdamer Platz and is very central to most attractions. The room was large with a king size bed. We had executive level access due to my rewards membership, so we were able to use the internet free of charge and also we had snacks, drinks, and continental breakfast provided on the executive level. Our check-in was smooth with a very attentive gentleman behind the desk. The room was extremely clean, great view, and linens were typical Marriott - plush bedding and lovely crisp sheets. I only have two negatives and they are we asked for a wake-up call the morning we departed and they said they would also ring us 10 minutes later to make sure we were up, but we didn't receive any call - this was very unusual. The other is the mini bar. You cannot empty the contents and add your own snacks because if you do, within 12 or so seconds it will register you have taken an item from the mini bar and it will be debited against your account. All in all a pleasant stay in Berlin. It is a bike friendly city as well with well laid out paths, but unfortunately the weather was too cold for us to hire bikes during our stay. The public transport system (trains) was difficult to understand. Eventually we made sense of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location(Near to the train station)”
Reviews.Author: MsSG
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Berlin was pleasant to stay in.The rooms were beautifully decorated and there were comfortable beds(not too hard and not too soft). Unfortunately,they did not have a queen/king bed at that time,so we had to settle for large twin bed.Rooms were clean although it was small. The lobby was very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: phoskins
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is Berlin was a fantastic hotel. Very new, and very clean, and the front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful. The hotel is a block away from the subway, and within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, and coffee shops. I would absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Above all marriott I know”
Reviews.Author: kleversaat
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Staff very friendly. very spacious rooms and a fitness center open 24hours, you know what guests love. Love that breakfast is served until 15:00 on the weekend. well done

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: janedoe2008
Reviews.Content: This is a terrifically located hotel that disappointed in only one way (later). The location was exceptionally convenient for sightseeing. The hotel is located in a section of city blocks that are all new high-end development. However, many historical sites of Berlin (Bradenburg Gate, etc. are all very close). It is also within two blocks of a lovely large city park that is great for running. If they were priced exactly the same I might still choose this location over that of the Aldon, especially if I were staying more than one night. The hotel itself is very nice. The breakfast was very good and very well priced in the package we got. We stayed two nights and the second morning we had a very early flight (at the budget airport - Shoenfeld?) that we could not miss. Two of us double checked travel instructions at the train stations. When we compared to the instructions in the hotel, we found that they were wrong (they tell you to go in the opposite direction on the train - no ambiguity, clearly wrong). When I did an additional check with the concierge, his instructions were correct, but he insisted the the room instructions were also correct until I actually showed him a copy. At this point he made arrangements to have the instructions in our room changed - WTF?? The instructions are clearly wrong in ALL the rooms. That was pretty unprofessional. Mistakes are always made, but admit them and correct them. He said in several years nobody had ever noticed. I'm pretty sure people have noticed - but not until they missed their flight! We checked out too early the second day to eat in the restaurant (I do think we might have been given the wrong times when we checked in, but obviously can't be sure) and they took us to the executive breakfast instead. That was also very nice and it was nice of them to accomodate us. I would very strongly recommend this hotel. Just be careful about details if something is very important.

Reviews.Title: “Ja wohl ... clean and comfortable !”
Reviews.Author: HH922
Reviews.Content: When I travel I like smaller hotels but sometimes you just need a "familiar face"... THIS hotel exceeded all my expectations after traveling thru Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia. A tall high rise hotel near Potsdam Plaza and Sony Center, it is convenient to most everything in Berlin and the staff is wonderful! While I was there they were renovating the Executive Lounge but the hotel accommodated everyone as best they could. The swimming pool - just the right temperature (something hard to find in Europe) - was a nice relaxing option ... the hotel bar was adequate, the restaurant food excellent and the breakfast buffet over whelming... Need a familiar face when traveling, this Marriott is the answer. BUT I wish the Marriott chain would "get with it" and (1) offer FREE INTERNET and (2) allow pets !!! Perhaps someday Marriott Management will realize that we older baby boomers don't travel with children any longer except our "pets"... No question I'll be back at this hotel when in Berlin ...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide408
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Staff was helpful, location was perfect. Came for business but stayed an extra day to do some sight-seeing... The hotel is literally located along the edge of the old Berlin wall. You are within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie and various museums. American Sized rooms with modern amenities. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “5*´on international standards - separate Saunas - felt like in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: joe1968
Reviews.Content: excellent choice for your Berlin visit: location AND Hotel is absolutely fabulous! Few of the staff was quite new and not fully trained yet by Marriott spirit (had problems to book my reservation to my Marriott Rewards Accoun) but overall this hotel is above the general German hotel level in quality, service and appearance. Stay here when in Berlin you won't regret it! Tip: we got priceline bargain for 75 EUR/night (bid $85) but also check their special offers stay3pay2 and breakfast-rates for the weekend. Private parking closeby for 8 EUR/24hs... Expensive Wifi as usual at Marriott :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: dieta_zanda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in walking distance to Reichstag, Brandenburger Tor, and Holocaust Memorial. Hotel staff are friendly, rooms nice & clean. Did not have breakfast there (cheaper alternatives outside). Pool & fitness area are very small. Bathrooms could be bigger, separate shower & bathtub would be a plus. Nevertheless, much recommended, esp. at discounted rate of EUR 79 per night (Priceline).

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel, amazing food partic in exec lounge”
Reviews.Author: Kate70
Reviews.Content: I had fixed to stay one night here and move to the Westin for a further 3 nights- which I did and now regret...(review of Westin also posted) the 5 star Westin was offering a lower price than the 4 star Marriott so I had booked to stay there... The hotel is not in a particularly exciting location, however within easy walking distance of the main sites, and with coffee bars close by. It is modern and not much atmosphere and the rooms fairly bog standard but by berlin standards- it is good. Service at the reception is excellent and also in the restaurants and exec lounge. The exec lounge is in effect closed for renovation for a month- but has decamped until end Aug to the end of the restaurant with an outside terrace on the ground floor. Much better most likely - and wow- the food and drink offered in there makes this hotel a definite choice if you are a gold or platinum card holder or have booked exec lounge access. The quality is fantastic- and you can have a superb full meal with wine in there (free) when outside you will pay 10 euros for a glass of wine and higher prices for not such good food. The other major food plus is the breakfast- this is served until 3pm so fantastic for tourists.. and has an excellent selection and fresh fruit juice- albeit not a British breakfast but I would defy anyone not to find something they like... Great Marriott bed- the best out there! I just wish they would put coffee making facils in the rooms tho... (Westin scored higher on this as I got a great machine to make fresh coffee... and a rare balcony in there to sit on.) There is a pool and gym- which I never got to. If a tourist- buy a 3 day museum pass for 19 euros- great saving and lets you in to most of the city's museums. The hop on/off tourist buses also are not bad for getting around- 20 euros for a ticket. The live commentary ones i think are better than the recorded commentary companies- info was basic and not easily heard. If I have to go to Berlin again- which I would only do for work as I found this city oddly disappointing- I would def stay here again. The food and exec lounge won me over big time!

Reviews.Title: “Sky High in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Theskellys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of July. It’s always difficult choosing a hotel in a city you’ve never been before and Berlin was no exception. Particularly as it has a number of recommended places to stay. However after searching the net and reading numerous reviews until I could no more, we decided on the Marriot. What an inspired choice, we checked in and were upgraded to a top floor executive room . This was spacious , modern and the magnificent views of the city gave it that extra something. We were more than pleased. The hotel is located close to most attractions and of those that were not within walking distance it was easy enough to get a train to them. The area immediately surrounding the hotel is a product of the new developments since reunification. We seemed to find ourselves drawn to the bars and restaurants in the more established districts, which is a couple of minutes train ride away . That said the hotel is perfect if not ideal for visiting many of the popular attractions. An organised cycle tour of the city caught our attention on the first evening and as a result we took a tour along with 10 other tourists a day or so later . Berlin is extremely cycle friendly and possibly the best way to take in the sights and a beer is with an experienced guide. Even if like the wife it’s been a while since you got in the saddle It was a great 5 hours and our thanks go to “Fat Tire Bike Tours” for a wonderful day. All for 20 euro each.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in excellent location...should be 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: nettynoos
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a treat staying here! This is the best Marriott hotel we've stayed in. The location was really handy as the Tiergarten was just at the back of the hotel for an evening stroll, the Potsdarmer Platz S-bahn station was across the road for easy access to the rest of Berlin, and the Sony Centre was 2 mins walk away with a huge variety of restaurants and bars. The staff speak excellent English and are so helpful. We arrived at 0800 after a long overnight train trip and wanted to just check our bags in, but the receptionist gave us a pass to use the showers and swimming pool so that we could freshen up. Our rooms were so spacious and well thought out and scrupiously clean (8 floors up with a spectacular view over Berlin). The facilities in the hotel are standard 4 star issue...bars, restaurants, pool, gym etc. But breakfast is the pinnacle of the whole experience! Everything you could think of was served there (except maybe Kangaroo steak!) but there was freshly squeezed juices, cold meats, sushi, steak, continental breads and pastries, AND it was served until 3pm on a weekend so plenty of time for a lie-in! The only compaint is that there was no beverage tray in the room but i'm sure that had we asked for one, it would have been delivered willingly to our room. The best hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star treatment”
Reviews.Author: SweetieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Sorry it's taken so long to write this up it was while looking through Tripadvisor for another break that i remembered about the Marriott. This is not to say that i was trying to forget the experience far from it. I have to admit that i am a very fussy hotel guest but i could not fault the Marriott from the moment my friend and i stepped through the front door we knew we had hit the jackpot. Staff were very friendly and helpful they helped us with all the information inregards to sightseeing and the best form of transport to use.The breakfast was endless as we sat there they continued to freshen the food and as the time pasted different food was added depending on the time of morning, i've never seen that before. The room we had, had two kingsized beds stunning bathroom and floor to ceiling windows widescreen TV and loads of room if i was to return to Berlin it will be the Marriott i'll go to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MOnica9
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin to hear a couple of concerts at the Philharmonie, and chose this hotel because it seemed to be near the venue. It was a 3 minutes walk so very convenient. It is also very near the Sony Center with several restaurants, Movie theatres and shops and also a short walk to the Brandenburger Tor and Unter de Linden, so the location couldn't have been better. The hotel itself is a typically Marriott, not very exciting, but you always know what you get with Marriott so no unpleasant surpises. Excellent breakfast buffet and great service. We didn't try the restaurant for lunch or dinner, but I talked to someone who said the steaks were great. Very pleased with the experience and will probably use this hotel the next time we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with particularly willing staff - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Haemdoc
Reviews.Content: Relatively new hotel, clean, attractive and quiet, in a good position near Potsdamer Platz, U and S-bahn, reasonable walking distance to Mitte and attractions. Small room (larger ones are available and I would recommend), but very comfortable with nice view over Ebertstrasse opposite Otto Bock building. Able to open full length window to enjoy fresh air, a great bonus. The staff were terrific - willing to sort out any problem, genuinely friendly and helpful, handled our somewhat eccentric requests with good grace. Rates on company website are pretty good for a 4-5 star, and some include free wireless internet. Cleanliness and standard of room servicing were excellent, one of the few hotels that routinely includes enough pillows for the bed. It would be nice if coffee/tea making facilities were included with the lower priced rooms, but a kettle and cups were provided on request. I would gladly stay at this hotel again, highly recommended for a relaxing visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prat200410
Reviews.Content: Back in 2007, me and my family took a tour around europe visiting a few countries. Berlin was our 2nd stop. Here, we stayed at the Berlin Marriott Hotel. This hotel was amazing!!....especially its service and interior. It's actually a quite newly built hotel so it has very clean and tidy interior. I especially loved the lobby area of the hotel. The atmosphere in the lobby is always warm and soothing after a day of touring the city (which is quite cold indeed) u get back to your hotel and just lay back on the sofas there and the view of the interior of the entire hotel from the lobby inside is just amazing...ill upload a few pics so u get what i mean. Now, getting to the room itself. We took an executive level double bedroom. Bedroom was very clean and had the best amenities u can imagine. Id definitely recommend a executive level room in this hotel since theres the executive club where u can go in the evenings and relax and have a few light snacks along with some hot chocolate/tea/coffee and just lay back. Also has internet access free inside the executive club so business travellers may take up their laptops and gain wifi access. The club is open all day for drinks and snacks but in the evenings they prepare hot fresh snacks and serve. The atmosphere up there is also quite amazing.... Staff at this hotel were quite helpful...everyday we wennt to the concierge and requested for a full day's plan and he was quite friendly and courteous helping us to fill all of our days with something exciting and fun to do aroundn berlin city. Overall, i absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Berlin and interested in a few nights stay at a comfortable and relaxing hotel in the heart of berlin city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: kamaaina_cutie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, spacious and comfortable hotel room, awesome workout gym and indoor pool, and great location. We were within walking distance of the Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate and were also practically right next door to the Potsdamer Platz Bahnhof and the Sony Center. Hotel staff were very kind and helpful and, thankfully, English-speaking. The only way we could afford this hotel was by booking the room on Priceline for $135 a night, which I highly recommend! Breakfast was not included with our reservation, but I did pay 18 euros for the basic buffet one morning. Probably not worth that price, but even the basic buffet was quite extensive and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scribe85
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I spent two nights here. We liked this hotel. The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The hotel is centrally located - near to (walking distance to) historical sites like Check Point Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, the holocaust memorial. Shopping is a stones throw away at the nearby Potsdamer platz "Arkaden." The subway is right there, though we didn't use it. This is a well appointed hotel and we very much enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - a little way out of the city but great value”
Reviews.Author: JackBauerCTU
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights. Impressive Lobby area with complimentry Tea & Buscuits. Rooms were superb, spacious with excellent facilities. The hotel is located next an impressive complex with shops & resturaunts. I took my Mum there for her Birthday as she used to be based in Berlin for the British Army when the wall was up. The hotel is located in what was East Germany so it was interesting for her to see how much things had changed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you have a deal”
Reviews.Author: slecombre
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a convenient location in Berlin (Potzdammer Platz) close to all the key attractions of the city. Overall I am happy with my stay because I had a very good deal on the internet (expedia) but I would never pay the regular price of this hotel because it would not be worth what is delivered. I had a very warm check-in and a room with a beautifull view, yet the room was quite small and the decoration of the hotel is getting old. You really get the feeling of a major business hotel of the 90's. Worst thing in the hotel: the gym. I always go to the gym when I am on business or leisure trip. It is very important for me. Beware here! If you expect modern equipment you won't find it. The swimingpool and the gym are on the -2 level, small rooms, no outside light. You just do not want to stay there to train or even to relax. Only one restaurant in the hotel but the dinner (very expensive) was very good and so was the breakfast. Very expensive internet access from the room. So if you just need a room in a "quality" hotel in a key part of Berlin then the Marriott could suit your needs (check-out the prices!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent deal (via Priceline) for a long weekend at the Marriott. Very convenient location just off Potsdamer Platz, with the subway right there, and easy walking distance (5-10 mins) to the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Unter den Linden and the Sony Centre. The hotel itself was built over the line of the Berlin Wall, and is very modern. The room was clean and spacious, and had a great view from the 6th floor over towards East Berlin. The lifts require the room key card to operate. Check-in was efficient, although check-out somewhat less so, but the staff were pleasant throughout. We ate out every night, so cannot comment on the restaurant facilities. All in all, a great deal and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidtraveller23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in early April on a 127 euro per night rate from the Marriott website. A friend and I had a room with two queen sized beds, super comfortable, very modern and clean. Lovely pool and sauna in the basement. Very security conscious (had to use room key to get up in the lift), excellent service from the housekeeping staff to the reception and bar staff (although slightly cheeky waiters in the bar who asked for a tip!). The hotel has a great location just off Potsdamer Platz, minutes walk to bars at the Sony Centre and shops at Arkaden. All in all a great place to stay, I will return!

Reviews.Title: “SMELLED GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: mack09
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal hotel! They pump the most amazing smell into the lobby- its the most relaxing, comforting smell I have ever smelled. I know this sounds nuts, but every time I walked into the lobby I felt good. The location was good for sightseeing- mostly tourist stuff around, but it was right around the corner from the Potsdamer Platz station, so the subway was very convenient. Rooms were great, bed was also great. We had 2 nights, and I really enjoyed staying here. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Stevie390
Reviews.Content: Berlin was a cracking location for our Christmas break, with festive markets scattered across the city, all public transport operating and nearly all the tourist sights open everyday. We stayed at the Marriott as it offered high quality accommodation in a convenient central location. Berlin is quite spread out, because of its history - the Marriott being located in the "new" centre by Potsdam Platz and close to the Holocaust Memorial and Brandenburg Gate. The surroundings are therefore very modern and rather 'corporate' compared to the older parts of the city. Like other reviewers, we were offered and accepted the Executive Club upgrade. The Club Lounge offers comprehensive free breakfast, free internet access, constantly available coffee, beer, soft drinks, and an evening buffet of wine, spirits, small bites. We certainly got our money's-worth. The bedrooms were outstanding. The restaurant is a steakhouse grill, so the choice was a little limited and we opted to eat out in a more "traditional" place on one night of our stay. However, there's no doubting the quality of the food and good service. Staff throughout were excellent. The Marriott's rates were almost identical to the other big-brand hotels such as the Hilton and Westin (both of which are in an older, more characterful location). We preferred the modernity of the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LKHS08
Reviews.Content: While visiting my husand's family in Sweden, my husband and I booked a two-night, romantic get-away to Berlin. This was our first time in Berlin, and we had a great time. The hotel was fantastic. I booked the hotel for $75 USD/night on priceline, and it was worth every penny. The room was very nice and the level of service was wonderful. I could not have asked for a better location. My husband and I explored Berlin over our vacation, and especially enjoyed visiting the Christmas fair next door. What a great time! The only problem we had with the hotel was that I had a hard time signing into the wireless connection on my laptop... although, that could have been operator error! I would recommend this hotel for anyone... great price, great location. As a seasoned international traveler, I would say you really couldn't choose a better place!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Simon073
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. The hotel exceeded our expectations. We found the service and location to be excellent. The room was a good size and comfortable. The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast which was fine but not exceptional. We would certainly be happy to use the Marriott again on a future visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good, American hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Sz
Reviews.Content: Booked this on priceline for $90USD. Significantly lower than even 3 star hotels in central Berlin. The hotel itself is lovely and service is good. With that said, it's like a little slice of America right in the middle of Berlin complete with ice machines. How novel. Our first room was slightly strange, however, with hardwood floors and no area rug. I say our first room because on our first morning we were awoken by what sounded like someone drilling in our room. When we called "At Your Service", their customer service line, we were told they were doing construction. 20 minutes later and 2 calls back, I was told that they were changing our rooms. We were upgraded to an executive level floor which was different only in the sense that it had carpeting and it was quiet. Don't pay extra for them. Location: Right across the street from the Ritz Carlton and within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate. Because we went during Christmas time, there was a lovely Christmas market outside our doors and a late afternoon Gluhwein was much appreciated when we got off the U-bahn after a long day out and about. With this said, Potsdamer Platz is not all that great. If we were to do this again, I wouldn't think twice about booking the Sofitel, Westin or Hilton because of their location in Gendarmmarkt.
