From the time we arrived very late on a Friday night to when we checked out on a Sunday morning we were made to feel very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Even when we turned up at the restaurant without a reservation at 8pm on a busy Saturday night they were able to find a table for us. Location-wise, this hotel is in a great spot, just near the Potsdamer Platz and about a 10 minute walk from the Brandenburg Gate. Actually, the edge of the building was built on the spot where the Berlin Wall was. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: laurakevinh
Reviews.Content: Booked this 6 months in advance and I cannot say a bad word about it. The hotel is fantastic, food excellent and hotel staff very friendly and helpful. We are booking again for next year. Beds, rooms and bathroom very generous in size. Cancun Bar/restaurant across the road, excellent. Kevin & Laura Willie & Terri

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful HOtel”
Reviews.Author: shaz44
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful weekend at this hotel, what can i say, service was excellent, everything that we asked for was provided, even down to apples being available at the front desk!!!! I have never been in a hotel where everything is still as brand new as if the hotel had only just opened. the bathrooms were immaculate. i would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnJF
Reviews.Content: Just down from Potsdam, a stone's throw from the Brandenburg gate and Unter dem Linden, and close enough to walk to the Nikoleiviertal, this hotel is ideally located (although surrpounded by high rise modern buildings, obviously as part of the need to invest in the former East) The room was excellent, the reception area maybe a bit too formal, but this is Germany, and the German's are the world leaders in being formal. I have German colleagues who have worked together for 20 years and they still call each other Herr and Frau, first names are verboten !! The bar was wonderful, copious quanties of Pils and Weizen flowed, as well as any cocktail you'd care to mention. One day it was raining as I was leaving the hotel, and the Concierge ran after me with a umbrella that I could take with me (mind you, he insisted that I gave it back !!) The restaurant was also very good, fresh and healthy, no sign of Knoedel or Weisswurst that is the staple diet in Bavaria.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: imtdocklands
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this superb hotel in September 2006. Fantastic location between Potsdamer Platz and the Brandenburg Gate, right next to the Tiergarten. Staff were friendly, corteous and polite and every request we made was met with a 'no problem' attitude. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Bar and restaurant were great - again friendly and helpful staff. Yet another great Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Top location, staff, rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Oilbert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights initially and then extended. Didn't really want to go home again. The staff was top class, very friendly and patient (not very common in Germany). A huge room with a great bathroom. The bed was heavenly and the breakfast perfect. Very central and still quiet location! You can walk right into the Tiergarten park and it's a very short pleasant walk to the Brandenburg Gate, parliament etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LITHIUM
Reviews.Content: I considered stayioing at the Swisshotel or the Marriott but chose the latter simply because it had some great reviews on this website; it was located next to the Sony Centre with excellent connectivity; and the Executive Club lounge rate was cheaper than the one offered by Swissotel. Here is my experience: My stay in this hotel was from 24th - 27th August 2006 on the Executive Floor. It was excellent - friendly staff, good food and great locality. This is one of the better Marriott hotels and I would recommend any one looking at this website to seriously consider this hotel. Access to the executive club lounge was actually very good. If you go on business or pleasure you can entertain guests there, and with family stock your daily needs (especially drink). The Marriott also has a pool which (although cold) was actually nice. There is nothing negative to report about this hotel. It was a relaxing and very pleasant stay. Enjoy Berlin - it is a friendly city which is child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be Faulted”
Reviews.Author: William50
Reviews.Content: I simply can't find anythring to criticise about this hotel. The facilities are to an excellent standard, and the staff do go out of their way to make you feel that they care about you and how you find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Pixelmaster
Reviews.Content: Booked this last year having read reviews on this site. It was a family holiday and we'd never been to Berlin before so I wanted a good reputable hotel at a reasonable price. Previous reviews pointed to an excellent hotel and they were right. €119 per night for a large spacious family room was good value and easily accommodated the four of us. The room itself was superb. First class decor, very comfortable beds and very quiet despite being in the hub of the city. Customer service was second to none. All the staff spoke good English and the cleaning staff made sure the rooms were in pristine condition with regular visits throughout the day. Food wise, theres a good restaurant in the hotel or there are numerous facilities in the neighbouring area, so all tastes are catered for. Prices are similar to UK averages. All in all, a very relaxing and enjoyable experience and a hotel I'd happily visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: storage
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in a Fantastic Location. The beds were heavenly, the room was large and quiet and I highly recommend this Hotel. Breakfast each morning was a large wonderful buffet where they also made special orders. The Fitness center was quite decent for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Europes best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Berlin Marriott is one of the best of the group I've stayed in, and I've stayed in a few. This was my 4th stay at the property and my loyalty is usually hard earned. The building is very close to Potsdamer Platz and the Sony Centre, with its restaurants, clubs and bars. Yet again my stay was flawless - the rooms are large and supremely comfortable, the restaurant is good, effiecent and well thought through, the bar comfortable, the service copetent and always courteous. The reason must be a really great management team, who motivate and truly value the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is right in the middle of Potsdamer Platz beside the Sony Centre so even strolling around the hotel, there is lots to see like parts of the Berlin Wall and a really interesting memorial park bulit in honour of the Holocaust. It is also right beside the Tiergarten which is lovely for lying the sun and taking some time out. THe Brandenburg Gate is only a few minutes down the road. There is also a lot of fantastic modern architecture in the surrounds with some really interesting designs. It is right beside a big underground station, there are always loads of taxis and you can walk to lots more of the main sights. I had a double room with two double beds which was really spacious and the beds were really comfortable. The bathrooms were also large and spacious. The food was lovely with a good mix of some traditionally German elements (ie lots of meat) and other general mediterranean flavours. Would reccommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a super stay”
Reviews.Author: addicted-traveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Berlin. Really enjoyed the stay and one major reason was the hotel. Very impressed. We have stayed at many Marriot hotels across the world and this is maybe the best. The bed was great, very comfy and the bathroom really large and gleaming. Everything was new and clean. Staff always obliging and helpful. We ate breakfast {included in the price} and found it varied and well cooked. We also ate in the restaurant on the second night. This was a really lovely meal and the serving staff were smashing. This wasnt cheap but it was no where near as expensive as it would have been in London or Paris. The location is perfect. We walked everywhere from the hotel base and found everything within easy reach. We used the U2 line to go to the Olympic stadium and found it efficient and easy to navigate. The stadium is well worth visiting. If you want a bit of luxury, good location, great food and great staff then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate place to stay away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to have seen any poor reviews on this hotel because I was more than pleasantly surprised by it's service and staff. The room was so comfortable, clean and spacious. The location is quietly deceptive because it is very close to some major sites and a large shopping mall (Arkaden). The area can seem a bit quiet but it isn't. We traveled with a small toddler and it was perfect. We had a lot of in-room dining and it was good and well presented. We left the hotel for a few days and we were so desperate to be back because nothing else compared to the comfort and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a short stay in Berlin between Xmas and New Years. I used my Marriott Rewards points (they go far in Berlin, as opposed to other cities in Europe). I arrived early (9am), and my room was ready and I was allowed to check in. WOW! The unbelievably friendly front desk clerk asked if I wanted to upgrade to the Executive Floor for 50Euro -- it was a great value, as it included free in room internet and access to the lounge with breakfast and coffee/drinks all day long. I agreed, and was so glad I did this. I was personally escorted to my room and then given a tour of the executive lounge. There is a taxi stand at the hotel and it is also in walking distance to many tourist attractions -- reichstag, many museums, potsdamer platz, etc. It is located next to the Ritz Carlton and you can book appointments at their excellent spa. Finally, they allowed me to check out late at 2pm, so I didn't have to check my bags and was able to sight see in the morning, return to my room and freshen up before heading off to the airport. I travel weekly for business and this was the best Marriott experience I have ever had. Bravo to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tute
Reviews.Content: Marriot is brand new and adjacent to Potsdamer Platz subway where there is a mall with a wide selection of shops and restaurants and cinemas. We stayed 6 days with our son and it was one of the few that would allow 3 people in a room with two beds which is typical for American hotels. Breakfast is spectacular- every morning the usual ham, pancakes, waffles,bacon,sausage, scrambled eggs, home fries- but in addition champagne, 4 kinds of juice, a full selection of great teas, an assortment of gourmet cheeses with some of the best full grain breads I have ever tasted. Scandinavian style selection of sliced salami, prosciutto, smoked salmon, pepper encrusted smoked fish. A whole section with three kinds of yogurt and fruits, nuts, muesli to put in it. The best was the boiled white sausage and handmade soft pretzels with homemade honey mustard. I know the chef made it because I asked where I could buy some. Good selection of newspapers in English and German. The wait staff was very efficient and attentive. The location was perfect. We walked to the Reichstag at night to climb the dome and the subway line goes directly to Potsdam where the Sans Souci castle "complex" is spectacular. The beds were comfortable but the best part was that the soundproofing is excellent. The doors are extra thick. I never heard anyone shutting their door down the hall or using the shower in the morning. I have never had that experience in any other hotel. Wake up calls are personal- not automated. The only sour note was the outrageous phone and internet charges. $3 euro/minute (local or international)which escalates to $5 E/ minute after 3 minutes. Internet access is 20 E/ day, noon- noon or 7E/ hour. It makes you feel like a stupid patsy which is not how you should feel when you are paying $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not perfect. But What is?”
Reviews.Author: sweeney1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September. It is in a great location and is spotless. The rooms are not full of character because it is a new hotel but they are very comfortable with all the usual facilities. The bathroom is great. Personally I do really appreciate tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom and was disappointed that they didn't offer them. It seems a bit odd to have to order room service when you just fancy a cup of tea and a biscuit! The staff were very polite and the food (especially breakfast) was good. The only slight problem I has with the hotel was the rather obvious orders they had to maximise sales at all times. It seemed a bit false. I suppose this is because it is owned by a US company and this is a style of operation that some US companies have. I'm not anti US! I love the US but the commission culture produces this style of service. Example. I ordered room service and rather than saying "is there anything else I can help/get you" which would have sounded fine they said "are you sure you wouldn't like a starter with that. How about the Soup". This also happened in the restaurant when they "recommended" the most expensive dishes. Only a small point and I'd still give it 5 stars but being an old fashioned sort I felt it was a bit too "in your face".

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MLEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the marriott for 3 nights in September, the hotel is nice and location is perfect, but lacks those small things that makes it a true 5 star hotel. The staff were friendly and very helpfull, we had booked a deal were we had bike hire and picnic included which was great as the beautiful Tiegarten was a couple of hundred metres from the hotel. Rooms were typical of most marriotts, all clean and still had that new look, we had a corner room which had great views of east berlin and potsdamer platz. Would recommeded hotel if you want a good standard of accommodation in potsdamer platz with easy walking distance to most of the main attractions and U & S bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a new General Manager - ASAP”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: I write this as I sit in my uncleaned room at the Berlin Marriott, having been treated rudely by front desk staff and never had the mini bar refilled. hmmm. Fine location (next to Potsdamer Platz and the new Sony Center with movies, chain restaurants etc.). A short walk to the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag. OK rooms. Standard issue Marriott with better than average comforters. Good food for a conference of the size I attended. Issue: Despite my request for a 3 night stay Marriott only booked me for 2. I only found this out by being locked out of my room (no note, no phone call). Interaction with front desk staff included a "guest is presumed guilty unless they prove otherwise' mentality along with a rather hostile request for my reservation form before the staff member would deign to help me. I had to explain that I needed a room key before I could produce said reservation form. Once I did (thankfully I kept the document) my stay was extended but the room was never cleaned although I did tell the housekeeping staff I was staying. sigh. Just like home. No refill on the mini bar since Monday - also like home I suppose. Interestingly enough I was there attending a pan European TRAVEL INDUSTRY conference where one of the speakers was the head of Brand Marketing for Marriott in Europe. Apparently no one thought to notify the staff....

Reviews.Title: “Mariott a treat”
Reviews.Author: amyAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location in Berlin, if you're not looking to stay in the swinging part of town. Many of the tourist sites are in walkable distance (Reichstad, holocost museum), very quiet and access to lots of public transportation (buses, subways). The hotel was marvelous, beautifully decorated and gracious staff. And we only paid 99 Euros a night for a large two bed room. Don't know if they still have the deal but definitely a steal. We had to prepay it 45 days in advance so it is only good if you're planning way in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Berlin Marriott”
Reviews.Author: beenthereonce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Berlin Marriott Hotel which was really a pleasant stay. The Hotel was quite new and located at a very quiet Plaze, but very central to a lot of sightseeing. We upgraded our room to the Concierge Floor for 50 Euro a night which was more than what it worth. It's particularly a bargain if travelling with children. It included breakfast, afternoon appetizers and evening desserts. Guests also gain access to internet (3 computers in a separate room inside the concierge lounge) and beverage/beer from morning til midnight. My 2 kids drank a lot of juice/soda/bottled water during the stay which will cost 2.5 Euro+ from the minibar. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The beds were super. Swimming pool is a bit small but nice, fitness room is also nice. The fitness/swimming room is always stocked with bathrobe, slippers, towels and a full bowl of apples. Also, security is good, one would need a card key to operate the elevator. The only complaint I had was we are a family of four and we checked in as a family of four. First night I had to call housekeeping for one more set of towels and more shampoo/conditioner. But everytime they came to clean the room, they only re-stocked for three even though I requested four, which is a bit annoying, but it's minor. Overall, we were very pleased with the stay and would highly recommend it. The Hotel situated at the borderline between the Old East and West Berlin. Metro is only a 7 minutes walk away. One even passed by a portion of the Old Berlin Wall on the route to the metro. Bus 200, which is kind of like a budget tour bus which made stops at most of the tourist attraction, is only a block from the metro station. Potsdamer Platz/Sony Center is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: neugermany
Reviews.Content: Just great - live every Marriott I have stayed at during the past years.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off phone system”
Reviews.Author: Francois_Godard
Reviews.Content: The place was relatively nice, though you still find the usual tacky taste in bathroom marbles and wall-to-wall floor carpeting typical of hotel chains. Swimming pool is very small, water is too cold and it is difficult to manage your way in unless you bring your own beach sandals. My main issue was with the phone system. As usual in that sort of place the call rates are up to 20 times those you'd pay at home with a competitive provider (say, one euro per minute instead of five cents, for international calls). But worse: their phone system blocks you from using prepaid phone cards, and they dare telling you that it is for "your own protection against high charges"!
